With his youth loan requested form Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Mohamad will acquire a large quantity of wood to be able to proceed with finishing his projects properly. Mohamad is very happy and satisfied with what he has attained so far, but the lack of financials at this stage is keeping him away from reaching what he is intending for; so help him out so that he can meet his needs and requirements.

loans.use: to acquire a large quantity of wood

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 52-years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marialyn has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Saturnina has been in this business for one year now.

Saturnina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 45 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Anahit asking for second loan from Kiva. She is running a clothes-trading business at a rented stall in the city's wholesale market. She has a lot of regular customers. The first loan helped her to buy an assortment of autumn clothes to resell, which she sold successfully and received decent income. With the coming of the winter cold season she wants to sell jackets and coats for women and men.
She asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy festive dresses and clothes for women and men in time for the holidays when she is sure she will have good sales.

loans.use: to buy festive dresses and clothes for women and men in time for the holidays when she is sure to have good sales

loans.name: Sreyngorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sreyngorn is 24 years old and married with one child. She and her husband earn a living through working as construction workers. 

Having been in this business for six years, she is able to earn about KHR23,000 per day and manages to save about KHR11,00 each day for future needs. 

Sreyngorn is the first cycled client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy construction materials for supporting her current business. She hopes to make a living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for supporting her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sanraksa

texts.en:
Sanraksa, aged 31, is living in a rural village of the Toul Kok district and has two dependent children. He is an English tutor in the village. Engaging in this job for five years, he can earn around US $8 per day from his current job.
 
This is for a microloan for Sanraksa with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to pay for his university tuition to study English literature. He hopes this loan will keep him in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for him to study English literature

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen, 34, is a married mother living with her family in a village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two children. For the last 16 years, Sokhen has been washing and drying clothes while her husband sells coffee and soft drinks. Together, they can earn about US $9 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sokhen has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Sokhen will use this loan to buy more coffee and soft drinks to resell and use a portion of it to buy washing supplies for her laundry business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is 56 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Cuc has been running a general store in front of her door for 18 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

Cuc is requesting a loan to stock her stall and expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 42 years old and is married. She and her husband earn a living raising cows and planting vegetables to sell. They started this business 10 years ago, to cover their family's expenses, and raise their three daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Be is requesting a loan to buy one more cow and fertilizer for planting.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Fuzeta

texts.en:
Fuzeta is applying for a loan of $1,200.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children, and her husband is a driver. She is running a business in her house selling brick.  She opened her  business in 2012  with her working capital of $2000.00.

She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy materials to make bricks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy an adobe print tool, sand, and cement

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en: Veasna is a 43-year-old mother of three kids, residing in Takeo Province. She deals with her daily cost of living through her food selling and rice farming business; she has had her business for about 5 years. Including this loan, she is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully completed the repayment of her past three loans. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to support her business and provide three decent daily meals for her kids. For this cycle, she is seeking an education loan to pay tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in finance and banking. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is a mother of four children, and now is 52 years old. She is a villager from Sangke’s District of Battambang Province. To earn a living, she has been buying and selling kapok in the village. To add up more income, she also works for others for a fee as the main source of income. 

The business that she has had for more than 10 years has generated her about 31,200 KHR per day.  This is the sixth loan for Bopha with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to improve her business better than before. For this cycle, she has teamed up in a group of four to get a new loan. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more kapok to resale. She hopes that she can achieve a good crop yield.

loans.use: to buy more kapok to resale

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma, age 25, is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making artificial jewelry. The business has great potential for growth, and she makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has four children, and wishes to provide them with good quality food, health, and education. 

In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Uzma requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her net income, and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda’s 27-year-old unmarried son passed away about a year ago and four months after him, her husband passed way as well. Majlinda  is 47 and has her 18-year-old daughter now. “My husband was struck from the grief from the death of our son, and that caused him a deadly heart attack,” said Majlinda.

Majlinda owns a little bar café on a main floor of the building where she and her daughter rent. Next to this, there is a little shop that she wants to open as a variety store. Her daughter can run it while she continues her university studies, and Majlinda will help her as well while she goes to school. The good thing is that there is no such a store in that neighborhood. 

Majlinda herself has worked in a factory where they made rugs and carpets, and she enjoys making her own rugs using the loom once in a while.

loans.use: to open up a variety store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-eight-year-old cattle trader who has done trade in cattle for the last twenty years. He works six days in a week and works twelve hours per day. The business is located in Ryanshana-Kashenyi-Bushenyi, and his clients are mainly cattle traders in the same area. In addition to the cattle trade, Eric also does some agriculture, which boosts his income greatly. 

He would like to use the loan money to buy cattle for trade so that he can make improved profits in the festive season of December. His main challenge is lack of enough capital. That is the reason why he has decided to borrow money so that he can improve his business and be able to earn more profits. 

Eric describes himself as a hardworking man and an honest man, attributes which have helped him to attain what he has attained. His future hopes include being financially well so that he does not lack again in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Christiana's Group

texts.en:
Christiana, who is an active member of this group, has been running an enterprise selling wax prints (African textiles) for five years now. She runs her business activities from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Christiana will use this loan to buy more wax prints to resell. This will be Christiana's first loan from ID-Ghana. She promises to repay the loan without default. She is doing great and still working hard to meet her business ambitions. She will use the extra money from her business to cover school fees and household expenses. Christiana dreams to own another successful enterprise and own a business bus. 

She will take this loan with her loan group which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying backing the loan.

loans.use: To buy more wax prints (African textiles) to resell.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Peace Group consists of four ladies and one gentleman. They have been working hard so that their businesses will provide them with the money they need to improve their own living conditions as well as those of their families. They live in Teshie, Accra. 

Samuel is 40 years old, married and has two children. He is a very hard-working person who has fought hard for a long time to get his family ahead in life. He has been selling second-hand clothing for six years. He has managed to attract a large number of customers. As a result, he enjoys very good sales. 

He is looking for a loan of GHS 1,000 so that he can buy a bale of second-hand clothing to meet the high level of demand that he has for his products. This will enable him to keep making progress in his business and to make the income he needs to support his household.

The Peace Group members need a sum of GHS 3,100 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothing to meet the high level of demand that he has for his products.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Unity Group consists of six ladies and two gentlemen. They have been working hard so that their businesses will provide them with the money they need to improve their own living conditions as well as those of their families. They live in Dansoman, Accra. 
Esther is 31 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard-working person who has fought hard for a long time to get her family ahead in life. She has been selling wigs for 10 years. She has managed to attract a large number of customers. As a result, she enjoys very good sales. She is looking for a loan of GHS 1,800 so that she can buy more wigs to meet the high level of demand that she has for her products. This will enable her to keep making progress in her business and to make the income she needs to support her household. The Unity Group members need a sum of GHS 8,400 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more wigs to meet the high level of demand that she has for her products.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been running a business, selling animals for many years with the support of her father-in-law. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been working in hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people in her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hoping to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Shahida dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Leh We Member-I Group

texts.en:
Mary is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mary was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, fifty one years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has two children, one of whom attends secondary school and one of whom is in college.

Mary sells firewood and has been doing this type of business for a number of years now. With her share of this loan she is going to buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Dúo Sandoval Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sandoval
LA SEÑORA ANGELA  quien es madre de 2 hijos  y es propietaria de   una venta de juguetes ubicada en el mercado de peronia , la cual inauguró  ella misma hace algunos años ella esta muy contenta porque le le ha ido muy bien ya que por recomendaciones de otras personas ella decidió aperturar su negocio actualmente ella vende 2 lotes de juguetes durante el mes y le va muy bien en sus ganancias, los hijos que tiene aun no van a la escuela tiene sueños y metas muy grandes los cuales desea poder llevar a cabo con sus hijos y su esposo e es por eso que ella hace de la solicitud de ustedes KIVA un crédito eL  cual utilizara para la inversión de un nuevo lote de juguetes pero en esta ocasión todo navideño agradeciendo que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud…
texts.en:
The Dúo Sandoval group

Angela is a mother to two children and owner of a toy stall in the market of Peronia, which she set up herself a few years ago. She is very happy as it has been going very well due to recommendations from other people she decided to open her business. She currently sells two batches of toys over the month and it is going very well in terms of profits. Angela's children are not yet at school, she has very big dreams and goals which she hopes to achieve with her children and her husband hence why she is seeking a loan from you via Kiva which she will use to invest in a new batch of toys. In this Christmas period she is grateful that her request is being taken into account.

loans.use: to buy toys for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout en blanc à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 57 ans, est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 03 filles et prend aussi en charge deux de ses petits enfants. Elle fait de l’embouche de petits ruminants moutons et chèvres qu’elle achète lors des marchés hebdomadaires du jeudi au village pour les revendre plus tard. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’année.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter au moins 04 chèvres de 12 500 Frs CFA pièce pour les revendre plus tard.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter son soutien à la fois à ses enfants et petits enfants en âges de scolarisation, en plus de satisfaire leur besoins en habillement, en nourriture et sanitaire.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 16, 2011 at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of women who live in the same village. They are gaining experience in their respective activities through a greater understanding of the program, which is helped by the presence of a large weekly market (louma) in their village. The group members practice small trade, and they share a bond of mutual support and solidarity. 

Mrs. Fatoumata, age 57, (standing at the far right, dressed in white and raising her hand), is the featured borrower from this group. She is the married mother of ten children, three of them girls. She also takes care of two of her grandchildren. She fattens sheep and goats that she buys on Thursdays at the weekly market in the village, and sells them later on. She has extensive experience of over 20 years in this activity. She plans to use this new loan to buy at least four goats at 12,500 FCFA apiece to fatten and sell at a later date. 

She will use her profits to support her children and grandchildren' education, and to provide for their clothing, food and sanitary needs.

loans.use: to buy at least four goats at 12,500 FCFA apiece to fatten and sell at a later date.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз предприниматель, проживающий в столице Таджикистана, в городе Душанбе. Ему 23 года. Он уже женат, но пока детей не имеет. Бехруз в центральном универсальном магазине имеет точку продажи, где занимается продажей телефонов и его аксессуаров. Жена работает вместе с ним. Это их семейный бизнес. Бехруз начал свой торговый бизнес два года тому назад и до сих пор продолжает его. Прибыль с бизнеса является единственным источником дохода семьи. Так как Бехруз привозит только качественный товар, за короткий срок он приобрел много клиентов. Сейчас он просит в кредит 2000 долларов США. Часть кредита он собирается потратить на закуп товара для развития торговли, а часть кредита потратить на ремонт дома, чтобы подготовиться к зиме.
texts.en:
Behruz is a businessman who lives in the capital of Tajikistan, Dushanbe. He is 23 years old. He is already married, but does not have any children yet. Behruz has a sales point at the central department store, where he sells phones and phone accessories. His wife works together with him. This is their family business. 

Behruz started his retail business two years ago, and still keeps it running. The income from the business is the only source of income for the family. As Behruz only sells quality goods, he managed to get many customers in a short period. 

Currently he requests a loan of 2,000 US dollar. He has decided to use part of the loan to purchase goods for expanding his business, and part on repairing his house, in order to prepare it for winter.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to sell, and also to repair his house

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 22-year-old, single Lebanese man who has worked for the past three years selling food such as homemade food, vegetables, and grains. He is a hardworking young man with a very friendly personality. He sells his products to shoppers from his local community and neighboring villages.

Today, Rabih wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase food to increase his sales and to renovate his shop with the aim of placing new trays to better display his products. Rabih is very eager to receive these funds to improve his business, as he is working at this time on building his own house and he plans to marry soon.  So, he badly needs to earn a larger income to handle these costly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell and to renovate his shop to better display his products

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with two school-age  children. Joy has a business in snacks distributorship. This is how she earns a living, delivering snacks from school to school. She has had this business for two years.

 She requested a loan to purchase stock for her business.  Joy has been a member of PMPC for two months, In the future Joy  hopes to improve her living conditions and sustain the financial status for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase snacks to sell for her business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia helps her husband in managing their own farm for a living. She was successful with their farm, so she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy a new variety of seedlings. She was determined enough to gain more profit from the farm to improve their living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seedlings

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is 33 years old and lives in the Manga district of Tangub City. He is married with two children.

Bienvenido operates a business providing motorcycle repair and the sale of motorcycle accessories. He earns approximately 12,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to add to his capital to buy a second-hand unit of motorcycle. 

Bienvenido is a new member PMPC. In the future, Bienvenido hopes to improve his livelihood and provide more services to his clients.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand unit of motorcycle

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is married and has three children.  He sells his farm produce in town to earn a living.  After more than 20 years of farming, he has learned to sell his farm products in town to earn more income. 

To offer more goods, he took out a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit in order to purchase more vegetables and root crops to sell.  Rene always finds ways to augment their living. 

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing like pants, caps, bags, slipper and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing like pants, caps, bags, slipper and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por otro crédito para incrementar sus ventas en la temporada de navidad, el capital lo invertirá para comprar ropa interior y blusas, para seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior surtió su inventario sus ventas son mejores, su economía ha mejorado, con sus nuevas ganancias ha cancelado sus deudas y compro un mostrador para exhibir sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided on another loan in order to increase her sales during the Christmas season.  She will use the loan to buy underwear and blouses in order to continue satisfying her customers.

With the previous loan she stocked her inventory, and her sales are better.  Her finances have improved, and with the new income she has paid her debts.  She also bought a display case to show her products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear and blouses.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and has nine children. She is married and two of her children are still in school. Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Vilma requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business. She has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en:
Sokleap is 38 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She lives in a rural village of the Samrong district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 18 years. To add to her income, she has been raising pigs. She can earn about US $8 per day to support the family’s need. 

Sokleap has just sought a loan through VisionFund during this cycle. She is applying for an education loan for her daughter’s school fees. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to study until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business, selling cloths for the past three years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then resells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Shazia requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing better standard of living for her family members through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a businessman dealing in shoes, a business he started in 1993 with the purpose of getting a clear source of income that he could use to provide for his children. He works six days a week and 10 hours a day. Sulait also does some coffee trade, which supplements his income. He goes to different locations and mainly to open markets and his clients are all categories of people. 

Sulait would like to use this loan to buy bales of used shoes to provide additional stock for him. His main business challenge is lack of enough capital, but he is hopeful that this will be no more if he receives this loan since he will buy more stock and make more profits. Sulait's future hopes include educating his children using his meager resources so that they can attain an education and compete favorably for jobs and other things on the market.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Joran

texts.en:
Joran is a farmer, growing and selling tea in Rushinya Parish in Bushenyi District. He is an old man, aged forty-two, and he has done farming since 1993. Joran works seven days a week and 12 hours a day. He also works as a security guard at an Adventist hospital where he earns a monthly salary. 

Joran's clients are mainly tea traders in the same area and he would like to use this loan to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soils so that they yield more. His major reason for starting this business was to have a source of income that would help him support his family. Joran's main challenge is the weather which is not favorable most times since it affects the tea crop productivity. However, he is hopeful that this problem will be overcome if he receives this loan. He hopes to be financially stable in the near future and to educate his children to high levels.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: New London Traders Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “New London Traders” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a fast-growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. The two are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their profits and consequently improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of two. Kadiatu is forty-two. She was in born Bo city, southern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her one child who is attending primary school. Kadiatu has a food market, which sells palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), pepper, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of palm oil and pepper in order to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of palm-oil and pepper to add to her current stock

loans.name: Tememkoh Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tememkoh” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. 

With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales. and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. She is 35 years old and married to a driver.  They have two children. 

Aminata sells plastic bowls, baskets, dishes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, baskets, dishes, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana es una persona muy trabajadora, es el sostén de su casa, lo cual consigue por medio de su peluquería, comenta que su préstamo anterior de Kiva lo utilizo para hacer unas cuantas modificaciones a su peluquería para poder dar una mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para volver a refaccionar otras partes de su peluquería, ya que quiere siempre dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, pues esta es la forma en que ayuda y da a sus hijos todo.
texts.en:
Luciana is a very hard-working person, she is her household's breadwinner, which she achieves via her beauty salon. She comments that she used the previous loan from Kiva to make a few changes to her beauty salon to make her customers more comfortable.

She is now seeking a new loan to once again redo other parts of her beauty salon as she always wants to give her customers a good service as this is the way she helps and gives her children everything.

loans.use: to make repairs to the beauty salon.

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru: Сирочидин заботливый муж и молодой отец. Ему 23 года. У него уже есть годовалый сыночек, которого он очень любит. Сирочидин живет с женой и сыном в городе Душанбе. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Уже два года как Сирочидин занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Работа ему приносит не только доход, но и удовольствие. Хотя Сирочиддин имеет высшее образование, он не работает по профессии. Его устраивает нынешняя работа. Однако сейчас Сирочидин не может продолжить работу, так как его машина имеет технические неполадки, которых необходимо устранить. Для этой цели Сирочидин просит кредит. Он хочет отремонтировать машину и снова вернутся к работе.
texts.en:
Sirojidin is an attentive husband and young father. He is 23 years old. He already has a one year old son, who he loves very much. Sirojidin lives with his wife and son in the city of Dushanbe. He earns money for living through providing a taxi service. 

Sirojidin has worked with passenger transport for two years already. The works brings him not only an income, but also joy. Even if Sirojidin has higher education, he does not work with his profession. His current job suits him well. 

However, currently Sirojidin cannot continue his work, as his car has technical problems, which needs to be fixed. With this aim, Sirojidin asks for a loan. He would like to repair his car and again return to work.

loans.use: to repair his car, in order to continue his business

loans.name: Tilovat

texts.ru: Тиловат умелая и способная молодая девушка в возрасте 22-х лет. Она замужем и живет в доме мужа в городе Вахдат. Тиловат имеет талант шитья. Она шьет себе красивые национальные платья разных фасонов. Она нигде не работает и сидит дома. Сейчас она решила начать зарабатывать и предоставлять услуги швеи у себя дома. У Тиловат есть швейная машинка, но она очень старая и на нем трудно шить. В связи с этим она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить модернизированную швейную машинку. Тиловат в ее швейном деле будет помогать свекровь.
texts.en:
Tilovat is a skilled and capable young girl of the age of 22. She is married and lives with her husband in the city of Vahdat. Tilovat has a talent for sewing. She sews beautiful national dresses of different styles. She does not work anywhere, and stays at home. 

Currently, Tilovat has decided to start earning money and offer a sewing service from her home. She has a sewing machine, but it is very old and it is difficult to sew with it. Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase a modern sewing machine. Tilovat's mother-in-law will help with the sewing business.

loans.use: to purchase a digital sewing machine

loans.name: Nodir

texts.ru: Нодир дехканин, проживающий в городе Куляб. Ему 32 года. У него жена, двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Его сыновьям по 8 и 10 лет, они учатся в школе. А дочери маленькие, им по 6 и 4 года. Жена Нодира домохозяйка. Она присматривает за детьми и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Таким образом Нодир единственный добытчик в семье. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Нодир в этой сфере более 10 лет. Также он работает трактористом. Сейчас Нодир готовится к проведению озимых посевов. Для этой цели он берет кредит для купли минеральных удобрений, семян и топлива.
texts.en:
Nodir is a farmer, living in the city of Kulob. He is 32 years old. He has a wife, two sons and two daughters. His sons are 8 and 10 years old and go to school. The daughters are young, they are 6 and 4 years old. Nodir's wife is a housewife. She looks after the children and manages the household. Thus, Nodir is the only wage-earner in the family. 

Nodir works with growing field crops. He has been working in this area for more than 10 years. He also works as a tractor driver. Currently Nodir is preparing for sowing winter crops. With this aim he takes a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel for sowing winter crops

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 58 years old and is married to Rufina. For the past 20 years, Domingo has been engaged in the farming business. He is thankful with his business because it allows him to provide for his family's needs. 

With his determination to have continuous growth of his business, he is requesting a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. He believes he will be able to develop his business and increase his crops through the loan he will take.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to use in the farming business

loans.name: 3.14.614.14.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyên has a retail business selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic goods for resale.

Xuyên is 31 years old and she is married with two children. Xuyên is the group leader of the 3.14.614.14.thiệu Khánh Group solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown-up.

In 2011, Xuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuyên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic goods for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 42-year-old married man and a father of five children from Alicia, Bohol. He has been running a sari-sari or variety store business in his place for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.

Robert is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries. Robert hopes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his store as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods,  candies, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Duo Sumpango Sacatepéquez Group

texts.es:
Duo Sumpango Sacatepequez
Esta conformado por Emiliana de 36 años de edad originaria de Sumpango, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos la cual lo vende en la misma localidad, es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito con kiva para poder invertir en esta época de fin de año la cual los pedidos de ropa incrementan, ellas están muy agradecidas con kiva por la ayuda que les ha brindado ya que ha sido de gran beneficio para sus familias, espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito ya que en los anteriores no callo en mora.
texts.en:
Emiliana, age 36, is a member of the Duo Sumpango Sacatepequez communal bank.  She is from Sumpango.  She makes woven textiles, which she sells at the same place.  This is the third time she has requested a loan with Kiva.  She does this in order to be able to invest during this end of the year season.  The orders for clothes are increasing.

She is very grateful to Kiva for the help they have provided her with because it has been very beneficial to her family.  She hopes that they are able to help once again with the loan.  The previous loans were not in default.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make and sell typical woven textiles.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 63 years old and married with seven children.

Elvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Elvia has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elvia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 53 years old and married to her husband, with 2 beautiful children. After almost 28 years of teaching and selling ready-to-wear products, Luz has gone through ups and downs in this business. A few months earlier, Luz stopped teaching at her private school due to the massive competition of daycare schools, where many of her students transferred to public schools. After deciding to shut down her private school, she decided to apply to a public school in front of their house as a Grade 2 teacher. Hoping to be accepted in the school next year, she is now relying on her income through her ready-to-wear products. With this business running over almost 28 years, she is very successful in this style. Luz is a member of Paglaum since 2008 and having loans to expand her business. With an estimated income of 10,000.00 pesos per month, she wants to expand her business slowly and to give inspiration to other entrepreneurs like herself.

loans.use: to buy new ready-to-wear (RTW) supplies to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 66 years old and a widow. She has four children. She works very hard to help her grand children to finish their studies, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for 20 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

In the future Dolores would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti lives north of Bogor in a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Siti is married.

Siti began working with Ruma because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, she has had around $80-$81 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales) which has increased around 128% from her previous daily sales (before taking Kiva loan). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Эльмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эльмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь. Супруг Эльмиры-пастух, пасет скот местного населения, за определенную плату. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Elmira is 28 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Elmira has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Elmira works with livestock breeding, after having started 7 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Elmira's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow, a calf and a horse. Elmira's husband is a shepherd, herding cattle for the local population for a fee. Their monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for building new facilities for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Azwar

texts.en:
Azwar lives north of Bogor in a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Azwar is married.

Azwar began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has had around $13 - $14 per day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sudarno

texts.en:
Sudarno runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Sudarno lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta.  Sudarno is married. 

Sudarno began working with Ruma ten months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has had around $120 – $121 per day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Irwan

texts.en:
Irwan runs a small stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Irwan lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta. Irwan is married and lives with four persons in the family house. 

Irwan began working with Ruma three years ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has had around $210 – $215 per day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to obtain more capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Yanto

texts.en:
Yanto lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Yanto is married.

Yanto began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has had around $140 - $141 per month in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 49-year-old married woman, doing business selling milk for the past 10 years. She has two calves and one dairy cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Noong Luong 2 Group

texts.en:
Tuong, 33, is a Thai minority. He works as a farmer to provide for his family of 4 members, including an elderly person and a child at school age. He is mainly working at his family's agricultural production, that's cultivating rice and vegetables, as well as raising chickens and pigs, which brings him a monthly average income of 3,000,000 Dong (VND).

He is considered as a hard working and responsible person by people in the community. He will use a portion of this loan to purchase fertilizer for the field and food for pigs and chickens. He hopes that in the future, his business would be more stable, he could improve income to cover living expenses as well as have more savings.

Tuong is the team leader of Noong Luong 2 Group consisting of 13 members, a majority of whom are Thai minority women. In the picture, Tuong stands first from the right.

Tag line: #FirstLoan, #SupportingFamily, #SustainableAgriculture

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food for pigs and chickens

loans.name: Chernoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the "Chernoh" group. They are small-scale business-people based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. 

They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their respective businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The featured leader of this group is Chernor.  Chernor is 35 years old and was born in Kambia district, northern Sierra Leone. He is married, with three children. His children are attending primary and secondary school.  

Chernor sells cement and rice. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying cement and rice at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cement and rice at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: Revelacion En Dios Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Revelación en Dios está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres  y un varón. Son originarios de la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados  a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Diana y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, detergente, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, verduras, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la  compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal Relación en Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Revelación en Dios” community association is made up of eight members, seven women and one gentleman.  They are from the northern area of the country and are known as being hardworking, responsible, with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately they were not able to study for careers because they had to start working at an early age.

Thanks to efforts and desire to get ahead, Diana, the coordinator, has a general store where she sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent, cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, vegetables, and matches.  She works 12 hours a day and her business is located in her home.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her business in buying and selling food products and improve her business in the near future.  The “Revelación en Dios” community association is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people od limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to obtain dignified sources of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rakhmonali

texts.ru:
Рахмонали пожилой житель района Фархор в возрасте 58 лет. Он в течение 23 лет работает в хлопкоочистительном заводе в качестве бухгалтера. У Рахмонали жена, четверо дочерей и один сын. Его единственный сын сейчас находится за пределами страны на заработках.  
Рахмонали хочет параллельно начать животноводческий бизнес. У него есть коровник и начальный капитал в размере 600 долларов США. Рахмонали еще просит в кредит 800 долларов, чтобы начать бизнес. Он на эти деньги собирается купить пару молодых бычков. Рахмонали предусмотрительный человек и заранее подготовил бизнес-план, согласно которому он будет действовать.
texts.en:
Rakhmonali is a resident of the Farkhor region. He is 58 years old. For a period of 23 years he has worked at a cotton gin plant as an accountant. Rakhmonali has a wife, four daughters and one son. His only son is currently abroad as a migrant worker. 

Rakhmonali would like to start a cattle breeding business in parallel with his job. He has a cowshed and starting capital of 600 US dollar. He requests a loan of 800 US dollar in order to start the business. For this money he has decided to purchase some young bull-calves. 

Rakhmonali is a prudent person, and has already prepared a business plan, which he will work according to.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves in order to start a cattle breeding business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia has two businesses: her chainsaw repair shop and a sari-sari store. She has been running these businesses for a long time now together with her husband. She is from Corella, Bohol. 

Florencia is applying for a loan to buy screws, as well as additional stock for her retail store, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits and snack foods. 

With this loan, she will be able to improve her income from her ventures, allowing her to experience a better life with the help of her income.

loans.use: to buy screws, canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is  45 years old, married, and a resident of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. She earns a living through a buy and sell business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 13,000 to pay for the pawned farm land. And the income from her business shall be the pay-off to the loan she requested in PMPC.

Rosemarie deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for the pawned farm land

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 33 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines.

In order to gain an extra income for a living, she is engaged in a business buying and selling eggs. Jasmin has been a member of PMPC for a year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative.

Now she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase or restock more trays of eggs for her business. Additional inventory would increase her income and from it she will be able to sustain the other needs of her family. All she wanted for her family is to have a decent and comfortable life with adequate income. Jasmin deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 62 years old. She is married and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines.

Josephine raises pigs to earn a living. For additional income, she sells charcoal that she does at her own backyard. She has been in these businesses for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional heads of pigs and feed.

In 2009, Josephine applied for her membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She enjoys the benefits of being a member of the cooperative. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to save enough money for house repairs. She wants to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto earns a living by manufacturing hollow blocks. He is 61 years old, a widower, and he lives in Goleo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is now well-known for the nice quality of services he offers. He has already purchased some materials and was able to save from it. His business is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 7,000 per month.  

Jacinto is seeking a PHP 40,000 loan. He would like to use the loan to purchase materials for use in making hollow blocks. This is a regular loan and it would be repaid in a few months. Jacinto has never had a delinquency in his three previous loans. 

Jacinto is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of his venture.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials needed for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a 14,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rosa has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 8 years.  She earns more income raising pigs.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

She sells rice for consumption and they used some sacks of hog feeds for her rice but all sacks were already laundered and clean before they used them.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 49 years old and married with four children.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a 'buy and sell' charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the 'buy and sell' charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm frond) roofing.

Perlita aspires to save enough money so she could have her own land.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mao is 56 years old and married. She has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing sesame and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Mao has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s living standards. Now she and another member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully, and also hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Tren

texts.en:
Tren is a citizen from a rural area located in the Dambae district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. Tren is aged 53 years and married. He has struggled to feed his three children by growing cassava and cashews for 10 years. The current business earns him about 60,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the second loan for Tren with VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loan, which has helped him to better support his family. Now, he is applying for a loan. Tren is going to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Makara's Group

texts.en:
A father in early 20s living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Makara is a farmer who grows rice on one hectare. This is his primary source of income.  Additionally, he works for others as a secondary source of income.  This helps his entire household, especially his young child. 

He earns 18,000 KHR per day from his current business, which pays for food and other necessary expenses. This is the first micro loan for Makara with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a loan group of four. He seeks 500,000 KHR and other group members seek 1,000,000  KHR each. Makara will spend his entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee. He hopes that he can harvest his crop on time and earn a good income.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 12 años, se esfuerza por dar lo mejor a su familia para generar los ingresos se dedica a atender su llantería, ya tiene 4 años con su negocio, lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m., su ventaja es que lo tiene ubicado su negocio en la casa donde vive.
Invertirá en la compra de un comprensor, ya que el que posee no le funciona, espera continuar dando un buen servicio y así continuar manteniendo su negocio competitivo con lo que continuara cubriendo los gastos familiares y pagara las cuotas.
Aspira con tener un negocio más grande y bien equipado.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is married, he lives with his wife and their 12-year-old son. He works hard to give his family the best; to generate the income he makes his living tending to his tire company. He has already been working in this business for four years, working from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm, the advantage he has is that his business is located in his home.

He will invest in the purchase of a compressor as the one he has doesn't work. He hopes to continue giving a good service and therein continue to make his business competitive with which he will continue to cover the family spending and repayments.

He dreams of having a larger business that is well equipped.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, es una señora madre de tres hijos que ya son independientes, actualmente vive junto con su esposo y una nieta, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, ya tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia, es apoyada por su esposo y su nieta, su ventaja es que ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes.
María invertirá en la compra de alimento para pollos, de esta manera podrá tener debidamente alimentados a sus aves de corral, el resto lo utilizara para mejorar la infraestructura de la granja, espera tener en mejores condiciones  a los pollos, cumplir con las demandas, aumentar sus ventas.
Sueña con tener una infraestructura de la granja más grande, tener los ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos familiares y económicos.
texts.en:
María is the mother of three adult children. Currently she lives with her husband and a granddaughter. She raises chickens and has had much experience doing so. She relies on her husband and granddaughter. Her advantage is that she has built up a wide customer base.

María will invest in the purchase of feed for her chickens. Thus she will have the appropriate amount of feed for her fowl. She will use the rest of the funds to improve her barnyard infrastructure. She hopes to have her chickens living in better conditions, meet her customers’ demands and increase sales.

She dreams of having a larger barnyard infrastructure and more earnings so that she can meet family and financial commitments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Nurses Group

texts.en:
For the second time, we are very pleased to present to you this group of state registered nurses. We are pleased to inform you that the previous Kiva loan was very helpful in boosting their businesses. Kadiatu, who was the featured leader, was able to buy a lot of drugs and drips to add to her pharmacy. This enabled her to fill her pharmacy with much needed drugs to help cure her patients. 

Having finished repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan in order to further boost their businesses. Betty is the current featured leader of the group. Betty is forty-eight-years of age. She was born in Kono in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a monthly wage earner and the couple has three children attending tertiary academic institutions.

Betty will use her share of this loan to buy cosmetics, toiletries and medicines to sell. 

(In the photo is also Kadiatu, the former group leader who has temporarily decided not to collect a loan this time).

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, toiletries and medicines to sell

loans.name: Dúo Los Pedregales De Sumpango | Group

texts.es:
DÚO Pedregales de Sumpango
Este dúo esta conformado por Estela de 60 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales todos los fines de semana  cocina alrededor de 400 tamales y cuentan que sus negocios les ha sido de gran ayuda además como actividad secundaria se dedica a tejer, por tal razón solicita un crédito mas con kiva para seguir incrementando sus venta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito y gracias a Dios han pagado muy bien, además le a ayudado a mejorar la calidad de vida que tienen, y desde ya les agradese por su ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Pedregales de Supango Duo.

Estela, 60 years old, is one of the members of this duo. She makes a living selling tamales every weekend. She cooks approximately 400 tamales and says that her businesses have been a great help to her. In addition to the tamales, she has a secondary  business as a weaver. Consequently she is requesting another loan from Kiva in order to continue increasing her sales.

This is the fourth time the duo has requested a loan and, thanks to God, the funding has paid off very well. It has helped to improve their quality of life and they are grateful for your help.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make and sell  tamales.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 24 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et les villages environnants. les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Oumy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille. Elle fait comme activité principale l'embouche ovine. En parallèle, elle fait du commerce. Elle va acheter deux agneaux à 25000 F l'un qu'elle va élever et au bout de six mois le revendre à 50 000 F l'un. Elle va acheter de l'arachide, du niébé, des parfums qu'elle va revendre.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va renforcer son épargne, aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer à savoir participer à la dépense, à la scolarité de son enfant et aussi subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 28 members belongs to the Banc Villageois created on October 24, 2012. It consists of people who live in the same district and neighboring villages. They all get along and share a bond of solidarity. Their main activities are commerce and animal fattening. 

Oumy, age 46, is the member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is married and has a daughter. Her main business is sheep fattening, but she also conducts commercial activities. She plans to purchase two sheep at 25,000 F each that she will raise and sell after six months for 50,000 F a piece. She will also buy groundnuts, niébé, and perfume for resale. 

Oumy will use her profits to bolster her savings and to help her husband with the household expenses and their daughter’s tuition, and to support her own needs.

loans.use: to practice sheep fattening.

loans.name: Unisa Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Unisa” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Unisa (who is pictured left) is the featured leader of this group. Born in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city, Unisa is married to a businesswoman. The couple have four children who are attending primary schools. Unisa sells wrist watches, sun-glasses, mobile phone accessories, etc. He has been a businessman for many years now.  With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy wrist watches, sun-glasses, mobile phone accessories, etc. at wholesale prices to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Ma Candelaria

texts.es:
Doña Ma Candelaria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada y madre de 6 hijos pero solo 3 de ellos se involucran en las diferentes actividades de campo y un menor de edad quien estudia en la primaria ya que los 2 mayores están casados y en hogares aparte. Tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron como trabajar la tierra especializándose en el cultivo de café. Con una experiencia de más de 25 años doña Ma Candelaria tiene mucha credibilidad ante sus consumidores ya que la calidad del café que ella produce es muy buena, el sabor del grano limpio y bien trabajado. La tierra que ella trabaja es propia la cual fue heredada por su padre a quien ella agradece el esfuerzo y sacrificio para que ella tuviese donde trabajar y vivir la cual está ubicada a 20 minutos desde su casa de habitación y se traslada caminando en compañía de su familia.
Sus planes a futuro distribuir entre sus hijos un pedazo de parcela para cada uno para que ellos puedan generar sus ingresos, construir sus hogares y trabajar para su familia. Sus sueños ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mayores ventajas sobre los problemas económicos que el día de mañana puedan presentar.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas ya que de esta manera ella podrá asistir sus cultivos de café de una mejor manera y fortalecer sus ingresos para cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Ma Candelaria is a 46-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to six children although only three of them are involved in the different agricultural activities, there is one minor who is in primary school and the oldest two are married and live in a different home. Ma Candelaria has a complete primary education which she was able to achieve thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents who taught her how to work the land and specialize in coffee crops. With an experience of more than 25 years, Ma Candelaria has a lot of credibility amongst her customers as the quality of the coffee she produces is very high and the flavor of the bean being clean and well worked. The land that she works is her own, which she inherited from her father who she thanks for the effort and sacrifice he made so that she could have a place to work and live which is 20 minutes away from her home and she gets there on foot in the company of her family.

Her plans for the future are to share out a plot of land among her children for each so that they can generate their own income, build their homes and work for the family. Ma Candelaria dreams of seeing her children in better living conditions, better prepared to tackle the financial difficulties that tomorrow may bring. This is why she is now seeking financing to buy agricultural supplies as in this manner she will be able to tend to her coffee crops in a better way and improve her income to achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Russel Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, esta casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas, por las mañana  se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, y material de limpieza con ayuda de su esposo, y por las tardes trabaja en una empresa de limpieza, donde percibe un sueldo que no es mucho. El crédito que solicita Leonor es para aumentar su capital y poder surtir su mercadería y no perder clientela, ya que es una fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a cubrir sus mínimas necesidades. Comprará más electrodmésticos para su venta en esta época de navidad y fin de año. 

El sueño de Leonor es poder tener una tienda donde pueda mostrar sus productos. 

Es la quinta vez con Impro y la tercera vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Leonor is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Tembladerani area of La Paz.

She currently works more than ten hours a day.  In the morning she sells appliances and cleaning supplies with her husband and in the evenings she works for a cleaning company where she earns a small salary.  Leonor is asking for a loan to increase her working capital so she can stock her business and not lose customers because it’s a source of income that covers her minimum needs.  She will buy more appliances to sell over the Christmas and end of year season.

Leonor’s dream is to be able to set up a store where she can show her products.

This will be her fifth time with IMPRO and her third with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es:
Carlos, solicita un  nuevo préstamo para comprar papelería, tarjetas, recargas para celulares, tintas, entre otros accesorios que necesita para surtir el ciber y continuar dando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le dio a Carlos la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio, da acceso a mejor tecnología a los usuarios, su economía ha mejorado. Su familia continua apoyándolo en su negocio, todos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
Carlos is seeking a new loan in order to purchase stationery, cards, cell-phone minutes, ink, and other accessories that he needs to supply his internet café, and to continue giving better service to his customers.

The previous loan gave Carlos the opportunity to improve his business, giving users access to better technology, and his financial situation has improved. His family continues to support him in his business and all are healthy.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, cards, cell-phone minutes, ink and other supplies.

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsy, aprendió de su madre a luchar para salir adelante, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad, su actividad economía es atender una tienda en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y variedad de verduras. Ya tiene 6 años de  tenerlo es apoyada por sus hijos. Lo atiende de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. 
Invertirá el préstamo en compra de golosinas, bebidas, productos de la canasta básica y verduras, con lo que continuara ofreciendo una buena atención a sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaran y los ingresos serán mejores.
Sueña con crecer en su negocio, dar un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Elsy learned from her mother to fight to get ahead. She is a single mother, has two children ages 17 and 12, and works in a store that offers basic needs and a variety of vegetables. She has had this business for 6 years to support her children. She works from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM.

She will use the loan to buy candy, beverages, basic groceries and vegetables, with which she will continue to offer good customer service to her customers, her sales will increase and her income will improve.

She dreams of growing her business, providing a better quality of life to her children and paying her debts.

loans.use: to buy candy, beverages, basic groceries and vegetables.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: Vilma de 42 años casada y tiene 02 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependientes, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Los Capullitos” conformada por 09 personas responsables y trabajadoras. Vilma se dedica a la se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación a logrado apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de pantalones, polos, casacas y blusas pues lo piensa ofrecer por campaña navideña. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Los Capullitos” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Vilma se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chompa verde. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo está Isidora la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: Vilma is 42 years old and has 2 children, 1 of who is dependent upon her. Today she belongs to the group "Los Capullitos" which consists of 9 responsible and hard-working members. Vilma sells clothing which she makes to order. Thanks to her perseverance and dedication she has been able to support her children's education. The loan she seeks will be used to buy pants, shirts, coats and blouses to sell during the Christmas season. Her primary dream is to continue working in a positive manners. The "Los Capullitos" group is thankful to the people who have made this loan possible. Vilma is in the back section of the photo, she is the third from the right side and is wearing a green sweater. In the upper left part of the photo is Isidora who could arrive on time for the photo because of her job.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, coats and blouses.

loans.name: Frankline R.'s Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are teachers of a primary school located in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. School teachers usually come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they are being empowered to meet certain financial needs that, left alone with their mere salaries, would not be able to meet. Most often, some of them use these loans to pay school/college fees, either for themselves to pursue further studies or to pay their kid's school/college fees; some invest such loans in businesses; others buy pieces of furniture or a plot of land for future house construction; some use it to buy house building materials.
