Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 6 años de vender blusas, camisas, sandalias, pantalones, y otros que le encargan. las ventas las realiza en su casa y por encargos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio con mas mercadería de ropa y calzado en general para aumentar las ventas en la temporada. Su objetivo es obtener mejores ingresos para tener bienestar con su familia.
texts.en: Adilia is 35 years old, a single mother, has a son, and lives in the town of Esparta, Atlantida.  She has always been a merchant and has been selling blouses, shirts, sandals, pants, and other things people request for six years.  She makes her sales from her home or accepts orders.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to stock her business with more merchandise, clothing, and shoes in general so she can increase her sales this season.  Her goal is to increase her income and wellbeing for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, sus hijos ya son independientes, vive solo junto a su esposa, se dedica vender artículos de primera necesidad en su vehículo, lo hace todos los días, ya tiene cinco años de experiencia.
Invertirá en la compra de verduras, granos básicos, jabón detergentes, entre otros productos para salir a vender y sacar el mejor provecho de sus recorridos, espera fortalecer el negocio para seguir cambiando el estilo de vida familiar.
Aspira seguir ampliando su negocio para salir con sus compromisos económicos
texts.en:
Jose is 52 years old, married and his children are adults.  He only lives with his wife now and he sells primary needs items from his vehicle.  He does this every say and has been doing so for five years.

He will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, soap, detergents, and other things to sell and make better use of his runs.  He hopes to strengthen his business so he can continue changing the family’s style of life.

He wants to continue expanding his business so he can get ahead with his financial commitments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elyssa

texts.en:
Elyssa fell into her dream job by accident. While she was studying law as an undergraduate, her friend asked Elyssa to attend massage school with her. Though Elyssa had little interest, she agreed out of loyalty to her friend. Elyssa was surprised when she fell in love with the craft and decided to pursue her newfound love.

While working at a spa, Elyssa constantly had clients ask her about starting her own business because they loved her services. After working for someone else for years, she realized that there was no more room for growth within the company. She also wanted to be able to expand the services she provided her clients beyond the capacity of her employer, and started to develop a vision for a spa with uniquely client-centric services. 

“Finding the courage within myself to leave a stable job where I was on top, and have security to start a business with the possibility of failing was the most challenging part of launching out,” shared Elyssa. But with constant encouragement from her loyal clients, she finally decided to launch out.

Elyssa has just signed a lease for a space for a new wellness spa and studio offering comprehensive spa services, including massages and lash extensions. She already has a steady base of 60 clients, but is the sole employee of the spa. She will use her $2,700 Kiva loan to purchase equipment and products, giving her the jump-start she needs to launch her business and get it running successfully. 

In the future, Elyssa wants to see her business grow and hire more employees, but ultimately she hopes to build an oasis where clients can come to rejuvenate both physically and emotionally and then take that out into the world.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and products for opening her spa.

loans.name: Oka

texts.en: Oka is 25 years old and single with two children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Oka has requested a loan to buy fabric color paints, materials, a paint roller, stencils and designs.She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paints, materials, a paint roller, stencils and designs

loans.name: Seaso

texts.en: Seaso is 28 years old, a partnered woman with three children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Seaso has requested a loan to buy materials, an elei carved board, designs, fabric color paints, brushes and gloves. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, an elei carved board, designs, fabric color paints, brushes and gloves

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 29-year-old partnered woman with four children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (block printed clothing) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Sami has requested a loan to buy designs, stencils, fabric color paint, brushes, a roller and cloth. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy designs, stencils, fabric color paints, brushes, a roller and cloth

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 25-year-old woman who is single with one child. 

She has a small business, flea market; she has many years with this business. 

Makerita needs a loan to buy materials, needles, sewing machine, buttons, earrings, and bangles. 

She will use her profits to assist with her family's everyday needs. 

Makerita joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, needles, sewing machine, buttons, earrings, and bangles

loans.name: Evelin Altagracia

texts.es: Evelin tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 9 años y 2 años de edad. Para Evelin lo más importante es que sus hijos cuenten con una buena educación y con mejores condiciones de vida a las que ella ha tenido acceso. Ella se gana la vida como empleada de de una unidad de salud de su localidad. Tiene 4 años de trabajar como promotora de salud y es así como lleva el sustento a sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para mejorar el piso de la vivienda y para repellar las paredes del baño. Con el monto solicitado comprará: cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Evelin is 31 years old and a single mother of two children, 9 and 2 years old. For Evelin, the most important thing is that her children have a good education and better living conditions than she has had access to. She earns a living as an employee of a local health unit. She has worked as a health advocate for four years and this is how she supports her children. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to improve the floor of her home and to plaster the walls of the bathroom. With the requested sum she will buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel for cementing the floor of the house and to plaster the bathroom walls.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con su valioso apoyo Faustino podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo porque es temporada de lluvias y con esta mejora protegerá su vivienda de estas; así  podrá brindarle a su familia mayor tranquilidad y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Faustino is grateful to Kiva lenders for the valuable support that will allow him to purchase materials to improve his home, especially because that upgrade will protect his home during this rainy season. This would let him give his family peace of mind while he continues striving to make his dream come true, "Give his children a profession and finish building a home with respectable materials".

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad, quienes a la fecha se ecuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. José es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien se gana la vida trabajando como albañil. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que desea construir una fosa séptica y una pila para reguardar el agua potable. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir la fosa séptica y la pila que tanta falta le hacen.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, ages 20 and 14, who at this time are attending the local public school. José is a very hard-working and responsible man who earns a living working as a construction worker.

He wishes to improve his living conditions and those of his family, so he wishes to install a septic tank and a tank for storing potable water. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI  to purchase the necessary materials such as cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and also to pay for labor to install the septic tank and water tank that he needs so much.

loans.use: To buy: cement, sand, gravel, rebar and pay for labor to install the septic tank and water tank.

loans.name: Rodney Jesus

texts.es: Rodney está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar enseres para su hogar como platos, ollas, entre otros y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en: Rodney is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to buy household articles for his home, such as plates, pots, and other items, and this way be able to improve his parents quality of life, and keep working and striving to make his greatest dream a reality: ”to have a university degree."

loans.use: To buy household items for his home.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

Her husband owns a stitching center along with her elder son. They sew garments to order; there are many tailors working in the stitching center. Her husband teaches untrained workers, then gives them specific tasks for completion; in this way, he is discouraging unemployment as well. Her husband wants to buy a new sewing machine but he has already spent his savings on clothing, spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles.

Due to a lack of funds, however, she is unable to buy the new sewing machine. Therefore, Sofia contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that her husband can buy an additional sewing machine for the stitching center. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for the stitching center.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Maritza le da gracias a campo alto que es el único instituto que le ha dado la oportunidad de poder estudiar y comodidad de poder pagar las estudios, pero en este  momento le pido  ayuda a kiva que le ha ayude para poder seguir con sus estudios ya que no le hes posible pagar las cuotas que le quedan un poco altas.

Ya que no es posible entrar a una universidad por falta económica y no tiene en este momento la ayuda, su mama es fallecida y le colabora a sus hermanos ya que se le hace muy dificl y tiene que pagar arriendo, servicios y no le daría basto, vive con una tía y les agradecería mucho si le pueden colaborar.

Gracias
texts.en:
Maritza is thankful to Campo Alto, which is the only school that has given her the opportunity of studying and easy payment terms. However, she is currently asking Kiva for help so that she can stay in school, since she hasn't been able to pay her fees, which are a bit too high for her.

Financially it's not possible for her to get into a university because she currently doesn't have any support. Her mother is deceased and she helps her siblings. It is very hard for her because she has to pay rent, utilities, and it isn't enough. She lives with an aunt and would very much appreciate any help Kiva lenders can offer. 

Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 25 years old and married with one child. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, freezer goods, and groceries. She has been doing this for many years. 

Sosefina needs a loan to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, noodles, corned beef, tinned fish, milk, soy sauce, and toilet paper. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's everyday needs. 

She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, noodles, corned beef, tinned fish, milk, soy sauce and toilet paper

loans.name: Letasia

texts.en:
Letasia is a 23-year-old woman who is single with three children. She has a small business, flea market; she has many years with this business. 

Letasia needs a loan to buy kava bowls, materials, earrings, bangles, table mats, beer holder, Samoa war weapon, sinnet, and siapo. 

She will use her profits to help and provide for her family financially. 

Letasia joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, materials, earrings, bangles, table mats, beer holder, Samoa war weapon, sinnet, and siapo

loans.name: Aitofi

texts.en:
Aitofi is 26 years old and single with 4 children. She makes and sells elei lava-lava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years.

Aitofi has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric coloring paints, brushes, stencils and a roller. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric coloring paints, brushes, stencils and a roller

loans.name: Taalefili

texts.en:
Taalefili is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year.

Taalefili has requested a loan to buy cordial, plastic bags, sugar, Chinese lollies (candy) and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taalefili will make improvements to her house and take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy cordial, plastic bags, sugar, Chinese lollies (candy) and foam cups

loans.name: Iacinta

texts.en:
Iacinta is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells elei lava-lava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years.

Iacinta has requested a loan to buy elei carved designs, fabric coloring paints, gloves and stencils. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy elei carved designs, fabric coloring paints, gloves and stencils

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es:
Areopaquita de 65 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su familia pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente desde muy joven ha trabajado para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir de adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz de ojos, labiales, perfumes, cremas, delineador, rubor. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias de forma ambulante y  por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de cosmético y aprovechar las ventas de la temporada navideña, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Areopaquita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Areopaquita is 65 years old, single, and has an adult son. She is from Leon, a place located in the north of the country. Its inhabitants are known for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire to succeed. In her free time she likes to enjoy her family's company and spend quality time with them. Unfortunately, from an early age she has worked to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her effort and her desire to succeed, she has as her business the sale of cosmetics, such as rouge, eyeshadow, eyebrow pencil, lipsticks, perfumes, creams and eyeliner. She has been working at her business for eight hours a day, selling door to door and by order. The purpose of the loan is to have working capital for the purchase and sale of cosmetics, and to take advantage of the Christmas sales season, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. 

Areopaquita is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use:
To invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling cosmetics such as blush, eyeshadow, eyeliner, lipstick, perfumes,
creams, and eyeliner.

loans.name: Gerardo Erickson

texts.es: Gerardo agradece el gran apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y frutas como papa al por mayor, cebolla, pallares, frejoles, entre otros; con lo cual podrá mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y de esta manera poder seguir creciendo y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en: Gerardo is grateful for the great help that Kiva lenders are offering him because thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise for his small business selling vegetables and fruit, such as wholesale potatoes, onions, white beans, pinto beans, and other items. This will allow him to improve his sales and his income so that he can keep growing and fighting for his great dream, which is to own a minimart.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Abdulmoamn

texts.en: Abdulmoamn is 24 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store that sells basic products for two years. He started his business with supporting capital from his father in order to open his business. Because of his dedication to his work, he has been able to attract customers to his business. He says he needs to fill his store with more food products in order to serve his customers. So he applied for a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products that bring in more profit. In the future, he would like to expand his business to open a wholesale store instead of his grocery.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products that bring in more profit.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a 42-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Mele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Mele hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kid's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves and a rake

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Seleisa has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps (lamb or mutton belly meat), soy sauce, tomato sauce, garlic, onions and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seleisa will make improvements to her house and take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, tomato sauce, garlic, onions and foam plates

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda de 29 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de frijol en las afueras del mercado de Santiago Sac, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya ha trabajodo varios creditos ne kiva y no a caido en mora, en esta ocacion nuevamente solicita un nuevo credito para la compra de frijol ya que desea seguir creciendo en su negocio les agradese por su ayuda ya que por medio de los credito ella ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Florinda is 29 years old and sells beans outside of the market in Santiago, Sacatepequez. She has been doing this for several years. She has borrowed from Kiva before and paid back on time. On this occasion she requests a new loan to buy beans and keep her business growing. She appreciates the help and with this loan she will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quantities of beans.

loans.name: Loine

texts.en:
Loine is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish, crabs and octopus in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Loine has requested a loan to buy a spear, fishing gear, fishing net and a new canoe. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loine will extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a spear, fishing gear, fishing net and a new canoe

loans.name: Motootua

texts.en:
Motootua is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a canteen in her community and has been doing this for many years.

Motootua has requested a loan to buy noodles, milk, coffee, chicken, sausages, snacks and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Motootua will take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, coffee, chicken, sausages, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Pene

texts.en:
Pene is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She plans to extend her business by selling tinned fish, powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pops, chicken legs, etc. 

She has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, rice, salts, onions and chicken. Pene will use her profits to help with family matters and her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, rice, salts, onions and chicken

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en:
Pisi is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as snacks, frozen goods and groceries. She has been doing this for many years.

Pisi needs a loan to buy milk, noodles, toilet rolls, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, corned beef, tinned fish, laundry soap, laundry powder, cooking oil and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to help with her family's everyday needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, noodles, toilet rolls, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, corned beef, tinned fish, laundry soap, laundry powder, cooking oil and snacks

loans.name: Faamita

texts.en:
Faamita is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year.

Faamita has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and baking soda. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faamita will take care of her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil and baking soda

loans.name: Kerupi

texts.en:
Kerupi is 30 years old and single with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling meat buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a large cooking pot, salts, onions and chicken.

In the future, Kerupi hopes to use her profits to help her family and her improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, oil, a large cooking pot, salts, onions and chicken

loans.name: Iusitina

texts.en:
Iusitina is 32 years old and married with 1 child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, salts, a large cooking pot and chicken.

In the future, Iusitina hopes to use her business profits to help her family and her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, salts, a large cooking pot and chicken

loans.name: Percy Richard

texts.es: Percy está muy agradecido y feliz por el apoyo brindado a los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo Percy podrá comprar una casa de material Drywall, con lo cual podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que actualmente la vivienda que habitaba esta inhabitable, de esta manera podrá brindarle un techo donde vivir a sus hijos y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una vivienda de material noble y poder darles una buena educación”.
texts.en:
Percy is very grateful and happy for the support given by the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their great support, Percy will be able to purchase a drywall house, with which he will be able to improve his quality of life, since the house that he currently lives in is uninhabitable.

In this way he will be able to give his children a home to live in, and fight to make his great dream a reality: To provide a home made from quality materials and  be able to give them a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a drywall house.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is 41 years old and married with four children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, and oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven. 

In the future, Mere hopes to use her business profit for her family and her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, and oil, a large cooking pot, and a new oven.

loans.name: Falematai

texts.en:
Falematai is a 21-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green onions, tomatoes, green peppers, and carrots to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Falematai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. With her profits, Falematai hopes to improve her business and to save for her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Siiva

texts.en:
Siiva is 26 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printing materials to earn a living and has been doing this for one year.

Siiva has requested a loan to buy paints, design board, roll materials, brushes, rubbers, and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and her kids' educations. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, design board, roll materials, brushes, rubbers, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Malofouina

texts.en:
Malofouina is a 22-year-old married woman; she has no children. She has a small farm where for the past year she has grown tomatoes, cabbage, corn, green onions and green beans to earn a living.

Malofouina has been a member of SPBD since 2013. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy weed killer, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, a hose, a pair gloves and some shovels. With her profits, she hopes to improve her farm and help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is a 58-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, taxi services. She has been in this business for two years.

Koreti needs a loan to buy new seat covers and pay for maintenance, engine overhaul, registration, engine oil and fluid. She will use her profits to improve her taxi service and help her kids’ educations. 

Koreti joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers and pay for maintenance, engine overhaul, registration, engine oil and fluid.

loans.name: Ulalei

texts.en:
Ulalei is a 33-yearold woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, a taxi service. She needs a loan to buy engine oil, seat covers, fluid and a spare tire. 

She will use her profits to help her family living and upgrade her business. Ulalei joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy engine oil, seat covers, fluid and a spare tire.

loans.name: Nofoilo

texts.en:
Nofoilo is 48 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nofoilo needs a loan to buy fertilizers, weed killers, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels and a rake. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Nofoilo will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her kids’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed killers, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels and a rake.

loans.name: Taulelea

texts.en:
Taulelea is 44 years old and married with six children. For the past three years she has grown taro, cabbages, cucumbers and bananas which she sells in her community or at the market.

Taulelelea is applying for a 1,000 WST loan through SPBD to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels, a bush knife, a mist blower and a rake. She will use the profits from her produce to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 53, is married and has ten children. She would like to start a taxi service.

Mary joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to its financial services. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a spare tire and engine oil, plus brake and steering fluids. She will use her profits to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire and engine oil, plus brake and steering fluids.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajo Y Cosecha Group

texts.es:
DUO TRABAJO Y COSECHA
Don Tranquilino es originario de la aldea  Pacorral, municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 43 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace años.
Don Tranquilino se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, frijol, verduras y a la siembra de fresa, desde hace años. Gracias a Dios y gracias al apoyo de toda su familia el sigue adelante con su trabajo en la agricultura.
El sueño de el es mejorar sus siembras a través de un invernadero, ya que así  el tendrá mejores productos y mejorara sus ganancias así podrá mandar sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para la agricultura.
texts.en:
"Duo Trabajo Y Cosecha"

Tranquilino is from the village of a Pacorral, in Tecpan municipality, Guatemala. He is 43 years old and has four minor children in his care. He farms, a  livelihood he has been engaged in for years.

Tranquilino has been growing corn, beans, vegetables, as well as strawberries for years. Fortunately, and thanks to the support of his whole family, his farming is successful.

His dream is to improve his crops by building a greenhouse, as this way he will have better products and will improve his earnings. With this, he will be able to send his children to school so that they can have a better future. 

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and manure for agriculture.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure for agriculture.

loans.name: Nofoilo

texts.en:
Nofoilo is an 18-year-old young lady with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience doing so.

Nofoilo has been a member of SPBD since 2013. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy sugar, flavoring, foam cups and a new freezer. She plans to use her profits to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavoring, foam cups and a new freezer.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en: Debbie is 42 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan and a new oven.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en: Cathy is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava [a traditional type of clothing, worn as a skirt] in her community. In order to do this, Cathy needs a loan to buy a design board, paint brush, fabric material, needles, threads and a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a design board, paint brush, fabric material, needles, threads and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mariaana

texts.en:
Mariaana is 44 years old and married, with six children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Mariaana has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower. She became a member of SPBD this year. 

With her profits,Mariaana hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, shovels, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos. Tiene 36 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace  varios años, con el apoyo de su esposo y dinero propio, desde entonces, instalo su negocio. Hoy en día cuenta son su pulpería prospera y surtida. Su meta próxima es poner una librería en el mismo local de su pulpería. Solicita un crédito para comprar: cremas, perfumes, zapatos, artículos escolares, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar en su pulpería artículos variados. Estima que el crédito será de mucho beneficio ya que podrá incrementar sus ganancias y crecer su negocio. Su plan futuro es apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor is from the city of Estelí. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. A business person by occupation, she has a small general store. She started this business several years ago with her husband's help and with her own money, and since then has opened her store.

Now she has a prosperous and well-supplied general store. Her next goal is to set up a bookstore in the same premises as her general store. She is requesting a loan to buy creams, perfumes, shoes, school supplies, and other items, with the aim of offering a variety of items in her store.

She thinks that the loan will be a great help, as she will be able to increase her earnings and see her business grow. Her plan for the future is to help her children with their education.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, shoes, school supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha  de 46  años de edad casada  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. Bertha  tiene una pequeña bodega   ya hace unos  8 años. La Sra. Bertha  ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su bodega  (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Bertha   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Bertha  es la segunda de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su polo de color lavanda,Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Bertha is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has had a small grocery shop for about eight years now. She has built a loyal customer base, which has helped her to earn enough money to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own retail space where she could sell her products and earn more income. 

Bertha will invest this loan in the purchase of more products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, legumes, etc. This will let her continue to satisfy her customers' needs and get ahead in this way. Bertha and all of the group's members are very grateful to Kiva for the loan they have been granted and for the trust put in them. 

Bertha is the second person from the righthand side and is wearing a lavender t-shirt. She signs off with the promise that she will achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, and legumes.

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en: Ailua is a 22-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She has a small business, taxi service. She needs a loan to buy a spare tire, fluids, brakes, engine oil and seat covers. She will use her profits to help her family and to upgrade her business. Ailua joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, fluids, brakes, engine oil and seat covers.

loans.name: Joselyn Guadalupe

texts.es: Joselyn tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa de la  madre junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 meses. Es madre soltera y trabaja muy muro para colaborar con la economía del hogar y para llevar el sustento diario. Ella trabaja como empleada de una institución de su localidad. Se dedica a la elaboración de sopa de pata junto a su madre. De esta forma se gana la vida y va sacando lo necesario para su pequeño hijo. Desea apoyar a su familia con las mejoras de la vivienda la cual es muy sencilla. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila y para encementar el piso de la cocina. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y hierro.
texts.en:
Joselyn is 20 years old and lives in her mother’s house with her little son who is two months old. She is a single mother who works very hard to contribute to the household finances and provide daily support.

She is employed by an establishment in her local area, where she works with her mother making sopa de pata (a traditional Salvadoran soup generally made with tripe, cow’s feet, yucca, plantains, corn, and other vegetables). In this way she  earns her living and provides for the needs of her little son. 

She wants to support her family with improvements to their home, which is very simple. For this reason she is seeking a loan from FUSAI, to invest in the construction of a pila (a concrete washing structure that includes a basin for holding water and one or two other basins for washing), and to put a concrete floor in the kitchen. 

With the requested amount she will purchase cement, sand, gravel and iron.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a washing area and to put a concrete floor in the kitchen.

loans.name: Hector Ulises

texts.es: Hector está agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar herramientas para su trabajo ya que tiene su pequeño negocio de reparación  y pintado de avionetas y mantenimiento de instalaciones eléctricas; de esta manera podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y prestas un mejor servicio, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y poder darle una profesión a su pequeña hija”.
texts.en:
Hector is grateful for the support that Kiva borrowers are offering to him. Thanks to their help, he will be able to buy tools for his job, since he has a small business doing repairs, painting light aircraft, and doing electrical maintenance work. With these tools he will be able to improve his customer care and offer better services. In this way, he will improve his earnings. 

Hector will continue to fight in order to make his dream a reality, that is, "Finishing the construction of his home and being able to give his young daughter a profession."

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 25-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business, providing taxi service. Litia needs a loan to buy a spare tire, aseat cover, engine oil, breaks and fluid. She will use her profits to help her family's living situation and upgrade her business. Litia joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, engine oil, breaks and fluid.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 39 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Miriama has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, onions, salts, soy sauce, garlic and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Miriama will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, onions, salts, soy sauce, garlic and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Kaiva

texts.en:
Kaiva is a 57-year-old woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows cocoa to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Kaiva has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, a bush knife, gloves and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Kaiva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, a bush knife, gloves and shovels.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 36 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for three years. Sina has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan, salts, onions, soy sauce and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sina will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, a large frying pan, salts, onions, soy sauce and a new oven.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is a 23-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business, providing taxi service. Aiga needs a loan to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, fluid, steering oil, breaks and engine oil. She will use her profits to help her family living and upgrade her business. Aiga joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, a seat cover, fluid, steering oil, breaks and engine oil.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: Loimata is a 61-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small business selling food at her canteen in her community and has been doing this for one year. Loimata has requested a loan to buy more chicken legs, taro, cooking oil, flour, onion, slats and a cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loimata will use her profit to improve her business and also her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more chicken legs, taro, cooking oil, flour, onion, slats and a cooking pot.

loans.name: Sharo

texts.en: Sharo is a 21-year-old woman who is married with one child. She plans to start a small business, running a taxi service. Sharo needs a loan to buy a spare tire, and brake and steering fluid. She will use her profits to pay her kids' education. Sharo joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, and brake and steering fluid.

loans.name: Leitulua

texts.en: Leitulua is a 43-year-old woman who is married and has 8 children. She has a small sewing business. She has many years with this business. Leitulua needs a loan to buy anew sewing machine, needles, threads and fabric. She will use her profits to improve her business. Leitulua joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads and fabric

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en: Mouena is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. She runs a small business selling meat buns and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Mouena has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, onions, chicken, and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mouena will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, onions, chicken, and a large cooking pot

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn runs a retail store selling groceries and also buys empty bottles in her community to make a living. She sells these empty bottles in town and she earns well doing this. She joined GDMPC recently and applied for a new loan to buy additional grocery goods and empty bottles to resell.  She hopes  to improve her business and wants to have a stable income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and empty bottles to resell

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 68 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is married and blessed with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Raymundo has a restaurant business. He earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Raymundo has requested a loan for the expansion of his restaurant business.

Raymundo has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Raymundo would like to expand his business with other locations throughout the city and continue to support his family specially the education of his children and their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his restaurant business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is married and blessed with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Elsie has a Sari-sari store. She earns about 12,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elsie has requested a loan for additional capital to buy merchandise to restock her store. 

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.  In the future, Elsie would like to expand her business and continue to support her family specially the education of her children and their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Dhirendra's Group

texts.en: Dhirendra is CEO and Ameet is the Director of Azadi Manufacturing and Distribution. Azadi's vision is to Redefine Freedom for Women in Rural India.  It does so by providing access to high impact women’s health and lifestyle products such as sanitary pads and solar lights to women in rural India. By giving access to Barefoot Solar Products to women in Rural India, Azadi can give women and their families the opportunity to be more productive and safer. As an added benefit, Azadi can also earn a livelihood while providing access to Barefoot products to other people in their village.

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Dúo Diciembre Alegre Group

texts.es:
Dúo Diciembre Alegre
Este dúo esta conformado por Marleni ellas es madres de familia y se dedica a tejer fajas típicas así como también a vender lácteos, es el primer crédito que solicita a kiva, ya que para este fin de mes invierte mas mercaderia ya que es en esta época cuando mas se vende, ellas promete pagar puntualmente en cada pago, para que en otra oportunidad kiva les pueda ayudar con un crédito nuevamente, para su negocio.
texts.en: The "Diciembre Alegre" (Happy December) duo includes Marleni. She is the mother of a family and weaves traditional skirts. She sells dairy products as well. This is the first loan that she has solicited from Kiva, since at the end of this month she will invest in more merchandise, because this is the time when she sells the most. She promises to be punctual with every payment so that on another occasion Kiva can help them with a new loan for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Victoria tiene 42 años de edad. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de tortillería. Inicio este negocio hace cuatro años, palmeando con poco maíz; haciéndoles tortillas a sus vecinos.  Luego, poco a poco iba realizando más tortillas, ya que le pareció rentable y demandado. Actualmente cuenta con su negocio próspero y productivo. Su meta próxima es comprar maíz por mayor. Solicita un crédito para comprar: maíz, cal, leña. Con el fin de mantener una buena elaboración de tortillas. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar la producción de su producto y poder abastecer con los pedidos de su clientela. Su plan futuro es seguir adelante con sus proyectos.
texts.en: Doña Victoria is 42 years old. She is a native of the city of Esteli. She is married and the mother of two children. She works in commerce, in a tortilla business. She began this business four years ago, shaping a little corn to make tortillas for her neighbors. Then, little by little, she produced more tortillas, since it appeared to her that [the business] was profitable and [her tortillas] were in demand. Now she has a prosperous and productive business. Her next goal is to buy corn wholesale. She is applying for a loan to buy corn, lime, and firewood, with the goal of maintaining a good production of tortillas. She considers that the loan will help her to increase the production of her products and to deliver the orders of her customers. Her future plan is to continue forward with her projects.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood.

loans.name: Vaatauomalo

texts.en: Vaatauomalo is a 22-year-old single lady with no children. She runs a small business selling snacks and finger foods, etc., in her community and has been doing this for three years.Vaatauomalo has requested a loan to buy snacks, salts, sugar, rice, chicken, soft drinks and onions. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vaatauomalo will help her family in every need.

loans.use: to buy snacks, salts, sugar, rice, chicken, soft drinks and onions.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 46 years old, and a married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, donuts, and pies in her community and has been doing this for two years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, onion, slats, cooking oil and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mareta will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, onion, slats, cooking oil and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VILLA QUIQUIJANA,la socia es la Sra. Martina tiene 50 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es separada; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picanteria,la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como cuy al horno,chicharron,lechon(plato hecho a base de chancho),entre otros, la socia también vende cerveza y chicha, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, picanteria, tienda de abarrotes, venta de granos, venta de ropa, farmacia, maestro constructor.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is a member of the “VILLA QUIQUIJANA” communal bank.  Martina is 50 years old, is separated and has seven children.  She has a restaurant where she sells different types of dishes such as baked goods, fried pork rinds, “lechon” (a dish made from pork), and other things.  She also sells beer and chicha and has been doing this for a good amount of time; things are going well for her thanks to the daily efforts she puts in.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman who wants to keep working and supporting her family.

She needs a loan to buy beer for her business.

The other members sell food, have grocery stores, sell grains, sell clothing, have a pharmacy, and teach.

The members in the attached photos could not attend the meeting due to work commitments.

The person with her face covered is not part of the communal bank.

This member is grateful for the support and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de belleza como: lociones, cremas, maquillaje y calzado. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad, y gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en la compra mayor inventario para su negocio, para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar: maquillaje, lociones, cremas, calzado, joyería, etc. para incrementar el inventario y así aumentar las ventas con el fin de poder percibir mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, who is 37 years old, lives in her own house together with her life companion and their two children, ages 16 and 7. She sells beauty products such as lotions, creams, makeup, and footwear. She makes her sales as a street vendor in the principal zones of her area, and thanks to her charisma, she has succeeded in winning the confidence of many customers, who prefer her more every day. She wants to invest in the purchase of more inventory for her business, for which she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to buy makeup, lotions, creams, footwear, jewelry, etc., to increase her inventory and thus increase her sales, with the goal of being able to earn greater income.

loans.use: to buy makeup, lotions, creams, footwear, and jewelry, etc., to sell

loans.name: Angelica Natali

texts.es: Angelica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su hogar y poder re faccionar las paredes de su vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo por su hija de 8 años,  a la cual quiere mucho, así seguirá trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en: Angelica is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support that they have offered her she will buy furnishings for her home and be able to repair the walls of her home. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family and above all for her daughter, who is eight years old and whom she loves very much. Thus she will continue working and striving to make a reality of her great dream: to give her daughter a profession and be able to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and repair walls

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky runs a cafeteria to sell meals to make a living. He has done this more than a year and he is able to earn money to meet the family needs. He became a member of GDMPC this current year and requests a loan to purchase raw ingredients to use in his cafeteria. He hopes to increase his income to further educate his three children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make meals for his cafeteria business.

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 48 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Emma has a business selling rice cakes and other snacks foods. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Emma has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Emma would like to have a stall for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Empenita

texts.en:
Empenita is 54 years old and lives in Baybay Maningcol, Ozamis City. She is married with three children.

Empenita has a shop that sells cellphone accessories. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to buy accessories and other materials for her cellphone repair business. Empenita has been a member of PMPC for half a year. In the future, Empenita hopes to expand her business and save more money.

loans.use: to buy accessories and other materials for her cellphone repair business.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 47 years old and lives in Sebasi Clarin. She is married with four children and one school-aged child.

Epefania has a sari-sari store where she earns approximately 5,000 per month. She's been doing this for almost 8 years. This business helps her to support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase canned goods and other grocery items.

She's been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and other grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesús 2 está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Ursulina es parte de este grupo, ella vio una gran oportunidad de poder crecer en este grupo, es por eso que decidió unirse a ellas. Ursulina se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y por medio de su modesto trabajo ayuda a su familia y cubre las necesidades de su casa, es una persona modesta, pero que lucha por mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias para la venta, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, para seguir con su venta y poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño Jesús 2” is made up of 20 women, all friends and neighbors who form part of the la Fundación Paraguaya elimination of poverty program. 

Ursulina is part of this group and she saw a great opportunity to grow with this group, so she decided to join.  Ursulina sells beverages of all types and helps her family and covers their needs through her modest work.  She is a modest person but strives to improve.

She is asking for this loan to buy beverages, such as soft drinks, wine, beer, and others to sell and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn is married with 2 children. She is 29 years old and lives in Pantaon,Ozamiz City.

Cerelyn earns a living by operating her sari-sari store.  She has had this business for 5 years and earns 45,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, sack of rice, etc.

Cerelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Cerelyn hopes to save money for their future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sacks of rice , beverages, soft drinks, etc. for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 68-year-old widow with 7 children. She lives in Baybay Maningcol,Ozamiz City.

Virginia earns a living by operating her sari-sari store.  She has had this business for 20 years and  earns 21,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan for 15,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, sacks of rice, etc.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Virginia hopes to save money for her future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari business.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda is 60 years old and lives in Sebasi Clarin.  She is married with eight children.  Arlinda has a retail business, earning approximately 2,000 a month.  She's been doing this for almost three years.  This business helps her to support her family.  She is now applying for a loan to buy new ready-to-wear products to sell.  She's been a member of PMPC for almost four years.

loans.use: to buy new ready-to-wear products to sell.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en: Ailene is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She lives in Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Ocidental. Her husband is a fisherman and they have a fishing business. She requests a loan to buy fishing materials. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials needed for her fishing business.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 61-year-old hard working mother who resides in the Lala-o, San Juan, Siquijor, Philippines. She has 2 children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to meet the family's daily needs. So, Lourdes started a food stand or “carenderia”  business more than a year ago. 

Lourdes wants to expand her food stand business .  She wants to make enough profit to sustain her family, especially her children.  She would like to be able to send her son to college. In order for Lourdes to make her wish possible, she needs 14,900 PHP and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things needed in the food stand. 

She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as vegetables, fish and meat.

loans.name: Bhauraba

texts.en:
Bhauraba is a 23-year-old  differently-able man living with his parents and one younger brother in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. He has owned a small grocery shop in his village for the past three years and also does paddy cultivation on his family’s land. From both the activities, he manages to make 3,000 INR per month. His father is a daily laborer and is able to earn 6,000 INR a month for the family while his brother is still studying in school, and also helps Bhauraba to bring grocery items from the main market. Bhauraba gives his earnings to his father to help with the monthly household expenses and to take care of the fields.

He would like to become more independent and support his parents more, so he would like to start purchasing the grocery items in bulk quantity to avoid the high purchase price and earn a higher profit.  Additionally, he would like to purchase a fridge for the shop so he can sell cold drinks and perishable items. Bhauraba has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing the refrigerator, cold drinks, and bulk items such as sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, biscuits, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a refrigerator, cold drinks, and bulk items such as sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, biscuits etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Nery Ursula

texts.es: Nery esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes para su cultivo y también poder comprar semillas para poder seguir sembrado su parcela de cultivo, de esta manera podrá dar un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en: Nery is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they are offering her, she will be able to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops, and she will also be able to buy seeds to be able to continue planting her parcel of crops. In this way she will be able to give good maintenance to her crops and have a good harvest  and be able to improve her income. Thus she will be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and continue striving to make a reality of her great dream: to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of four children; three children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brothers).   

She has restaurant business; she has been in this business for 11 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, and rice. 

She generates additional income from selling vegetables like cabbages and fresh peas.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.  

She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant with a fridge so as to start selling soft drinks and  also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent .

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, rice and beef

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es: Fredy de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Fredy se dedica a la reparación de prendas de oro desde hace mucho tiempo. Tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Fredy desea terminar de construir un cuarto para sus hijos ya que su vivienda es muy pequeña y no es muy cómodo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, grava, cemento, hierro y arena para dar final al cuarto dormitorio para sus hijos.
texts.en: Fredy is 34 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 2.  Fredy has been repairing gold jewelry for a long time.  He has lots of experience in the business because he has many customers.  Fredy wants to finish building a room for his children because his house is very small and not very comfortable.  He is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can buy bricks, gravel, cement, iron bars, and sand to finish his children’s bedroom.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Dúo Gloria A Dios Group

texts.es:
Duo Gloria A Dios
Este dúo lo conforman Janehira Noemi ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos y bordados típicos, ella necesita comprar hilos, telas y materiales para seguir tejiendo ya que tiene pedidos y necesita comprar producto por mayor para conseguir un buen precio. El sueño de ella es abrir una tienda en donde pueda vender y exponer sus propios tejidos y esperan que Fape y Kiva las ayude a cumplir sus sueños para asi ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Duo Gloria A Dios

This duo includes Janehira Noemi.  She does typical weaving and embroidery and needs to buy thread, fabric, and supplies because she has orders and needs to buy products in quantity to get a good price.  Her dream is to open a store where she can sell and display her own weavings and she hopes that FAPE and Kiva will help her achieve her dreams so they can help their families have better incomes.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Aida Rosemary

texts.en:
Aida Rosemary is a 48-year-old married woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. She owns a bar along a busy market street and owns rentals as additional income. She started this business so that she can meet her family's basic needs, including educating her children. She faces challenges of limited capital for expansion and customers who don't pay her on time. Her dream is to educate her children to higher institutions of learning and also to construct more rentals to increase her income.

Aida Rosemary requests a loan to buy soda, beer and spirits to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and spirits to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a widow who  makes a living with her retail business. She sells selected grocery items and food in her little stall and earns enough money to meet her basic needs. She joined GDMPC and requests a loan to purchase additional grocery goods like canned goods and noodles. 

She plans to build a shelter where she could sell her goods comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods like canned goods and noodles.

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 25 years old and single. He lives in  Mabini Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Vincent has operated an online games and internet cafe business for 3 years and earns a monthly income of 14,000 PHP. He requests a loan to purchase another computer unit. He is a good member and a business-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase 1 computer unit.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 64 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with 3 children. 

Mario operates an restaurant business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. He requests a loan to purchase additional amounts of meat, beef, chicken and spices for his business. 

Mario has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Mario hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of meat, beef, chicken and spices.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a fisherman who never tires of supporting their big family. 

In 2012, she applied her membership to Paglaum MPC because of all the benefits available to members.  She continues to be a credible member in good standing and always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

She asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital for the fishing business.  She makes use of torn foam in their fish nets and hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she plans to earn more income and help to expand the business.  

Emma has found comfort in meeting their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, a single mother of two children, is an enterprising woman.She started a garments business five years ago because of her love for fashion and also to get money to meet the needs of her children, being a single mother. 

She has seen has business transform and to improve it she has been acquiring loans from Ugafode to boost the business. This being festive season, she wants a loan to buy a stock of fashionable trends to attract a large corporate class to her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jayasen

texts.en:
Jayasen is a 35-year-old differently abled man residing with his wife and daughter in a village in Odisha, a state on the Eastern coast of India. He suffers from paralysis on the left side of his body, but this has not prevented him from working hard to support his family. For the past 13 years, he has been running a small shop in the market near where he lives, selling snacks and the very popular local Betel nut. His wife often helps him with the shop while their daughter attends the local school.

Jayasen would now like to expand his business to be a full variety shop, with basic household items and packaged snacks. This would allow him to increase his income and better support his family. For years several years now, they have been saving money for this expansion, accumulating 40,000 INR. However, because of his disability, Jayasen has had difficulty getting the final financing he needs to make his dreams a reality. 

Now, he is asking for a loan from Kiva for the final 10,000 INR he needs to meet his budget. As he is still living in a rented house, he hopes the extra income he will earn from the new shop will allow him to save enough money for his family to invest in a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase basic household items and packaged snacks to sell

loans.name: Nazish Tanveer

texts.en:
Nazish is a 24-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, daughter, and son. Her husband is a tailor by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past 3-years, in addition to tailoring, he has been driving a taxi. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Nazish, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new tailoring shop in the future. Nazish desires to provide a quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay to repair her husband's taxi engine

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past six years. 

She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 
As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan to buy stocks of rice, flour, and sugar from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase her business capital. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: To buy inventories for her general store.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.en:
Hechong runs a tea stall at the centre of the town market, which is about 40 kms from Imphal town. The shop has an immense advantage in earning as it is located close to the town parking shed. Tired and exhausted travelers usually drop in for a cup of tea to start off and she also tries her best to give good customer service. She is the featured borrower member for Esther Group and she is pictured with her hand raised.

Hechong opens the shop early in the morning and usually closes down before the sunset. Her business peak time is early morning and at noon time. Her tea stall is a success and she is earning well. The generated income is insufficient for the family as she also takes care of her husband's nieces and nephew who were unfortunately abandoned by their father.
  
She is striving hard together with her husband to manage the family expenses and also to stand as a financially independent woman.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more sacks of flour and wheat, and also juices and cold drinks to sell. The burden of rolling out the capital money for investment has been fulfilled by Kiva and she is very glad. Earlier, she used to get capital money from local money investors with high interest rates. 

She says she will try her best to expand the shop and make more income to support the family and give good education for the children.

The rest of the group members are engaged in poultry, weaving, selling  garments, and running a tea stall.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of flour and wheat, and also juices and cold drinks for the tea stall.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael es originario de la ciudad de Wiwili, Jinotega. De 32 años de edad, padre soltero de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace varios años, el cual con poco y mucho esfuerzo  dinero decide instalar su pulpería. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio estable y rentable. Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Solicita un crédito para comprar: papel higiénico, arroz, azúcar, detergentes, sodas, frijoles, entre otros, con el fin de mantener surtido sus productos. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtener buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir luchando con esfuerzos para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y ayudarlos a que estudien en la universidad.
texts.en: Ismael is originally from the city of Wiwili, Jinotega. She is 32 years old and a single father of 3 children. He is a merchant and is in the grocery store business for a living. He began the business some years ago. With little money and much strength he decided to install his grocery store. Today he says his business is stable and profitable. He goal is to support his children with their studies. He is requesting a loan to purchase: toilet paper, rice, sugar, detergents, sodas, beans, etc. with the goal of keeping his products stocked. He says that the credit will be beneficial as he will grow his sales and obtain good earnings. His future plan is to continue struggling for his children to have a better quality of life and help them to study in college.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, rice, sugar, detergents, sodas, beans, etc.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Fadhil, who is in his early 30s, is a divorcee with two children who are still going to school. He is staying with his young brother who is still at school. He has been running a general store for eight years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fadhil's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, open another general store and buy items for his general stores. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans. He used the profits to pay the school fees and cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to buy inventory and meet his customers' demands. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Fadhil will share this loan with his loan group Iringa, whose members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda is 64 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Geralda has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products.  She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Geralda has been a member of PMPC for 13 years.  In the future Geralda hopes to expand her business.
