loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 42 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Merlie raises hogs and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. She requests a loan to purchase building materials like hollow blocks, cement and nails for house repairs and renovations. 

Merlie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Philippines. She has 5 children. 

To earn a living, Lina has a food stall business and sells food in the community. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month. Lina requests a loan to buy spices and ingredients for her business.

Lina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Lina would like to support her family members.

loans.use: to buy spices and ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 42-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in Pan-ay,Clarin,Philippines.

Marife sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Marife has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Marife hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with two children. She has been running a fruit juice stall where she sells different juices, such as orange, mango, and other varieties. Ann describes herself as honest. Ann's biggest business challenge is the rainy season when business is slow. She paid five previous loans with SMEP DTM.

Ann is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy a water dispenser and a gas cooker for use at home. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser and a gas cooker

loans.name: Viriasi

texts.en:
Viriasi lives in rural Lyantonde with his family.  Farming is his main source of income and livelihood.  He grows different food crops including cassava to eat as well as to sell.  He needs a loan in order to pay for a piece of land that he will use for farming next to him so that he can increase his productivity and also his profits.  

In the photograph Viriasi is pictured with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to pay for a piece of land that he will use for farming.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a third-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance applying for Ugx 3,000,000.  He is a married man with three children that he cares for, with the help of his wife. He runs a small wholesale shop at his home in the outskirts of the city.  It is this shop that has helped him be to able to feed and educate his children as well as paying rent for his shop and home. Cosmas’ major challenge is small working capital that is hindering him from making big sales that would generate more profits. 

Given the loan, he would like to restock the shop so he can eventually see his sales grow and thus earn more profits and also be able to meet all his customers’ demand.

Cosmas also hopes to buy a piece of land where he will able to put up house for his family now that his children are grown up.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in wholesale shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old man with one child from one of the villages in Ibanda. His child attends school. He runs a piggery project where he earns income to look after his family. He started this piggery business because he wanted to increase his level of income. He has been able to make good sales since there is less competition in the area where the business is located. 

He would like a loan of 2,500,000= so that he can buy more piglets that he will rear and the sell at a higher value when they have grown and also to construct an improved sty for his pigs. He also hopes to construct a permanent house for his children.
Charles is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and to construct an improved sty.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 50-year-old married man with eight children. Lucas runs a hardware shop in Nyarukiika trading centre. He has been doing this business for 10 years. He started this business because of the high demand in the village. Lucas has been able to make good sales and was able to send his children to school and buy himself a car since there is less competition in the area where his business is located. 

He applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX so that he can buy building materials in form of cement, lime, timber and paint to furnish his residential house that is in bad shape in preparation of the festive season and use a portion of it to pay tuition for his children. 

He is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, timber, and paint to furnish his residential house

loans.name: Stheyse Jhanneth

texts.es: Stheyse está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar utensilios para su negocio como ollas, envases de plástico, cucharitas, bolsas, sillas  entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y de esta manera poder mejorar su negocio y mejorara su ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando por sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 2 meses de edad y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una casa propia y poder darle una vida digna a su hijo”.
texts.en: Stheyse is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help she has been able to buy supplies for her business, such as pots, plastic containers, spoons, bags, chairs, and other things that will allow her to provide better service to her customers and improve her business and income in this way.  She will continue striving to get her two month old son ahead and work to make her dream a reality, “To have home of her own and provide a dignified life to her son.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux et pagnes au marché, Madame Akuwa est une dame âgée de 50ans. Elle a en charge des enfants. Il y a un moment qu’elle fait des opérations financières à WAGES et elle est à son quatrième crédit dans notre institution. Les trois derniers ont été payés avec succès. Ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui servira à s’approvisionner en bijoux et pagnes. Avec les profits, elle veut investir dans l’activité, devenir grossiste de bijoux et de pagnes et permettre à ses petits enfants de s’épanouir.
texts.en: Akuwa, age 50, has been selling jewelry and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) at the market since 1996. She supports some children. She has been a member of WAGES for some time, and she is currently seeking a fourth loan from the micro-finance institution. The first three loans were repaid successfully. This new credit will allow her to stock up on jewelry and pagnes. She plans to use the profits earned to reinvest in her activity, become a wholesaler of jewelry and pagnes, and ensure her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Jesus Group

texts.es: Dúo Jesus la señora Humbertina de Jesus quien se dedica a la venta de shampoo  por litro,y por galon, también desinfectante, que son preparados por ella misma. Talento que desempeña por enseñanzas de grupos para las mujeres con deseo de superación, Las fiestas navideñas están cerca y ella ya tiene varios pedidos de champo pero necesita comprar materiales como flores, esencias y colorantes para prepararlos y el dinero no le alcanza por tal motivo necesita un crédito para no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esperando que le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en: Humbertina de Jesus is part of this duo and sells shampoo by the liter and by the gallon.  She also sells disinfectant that she makes.  She learned this from women’s groups who want to succeed.  The Christmas festivals are nearing and she has several shampoo orders but she needs to buy supplies such as flowers, essences, and colorants to prepare them but she did not have enough money and needs a loan so as not to disappoint her customers.  She hopes that you can help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter un moulin pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, Yawo sollicite un premier prêt.  Il est marié à une coiffeuse avec en charge 02 enfants de 12 et 08ans qui sont scolarisés. Il espère assurer le bien être de la famille et garder la pérennité de son activité. Yawo est âgé de 45ans.
texts.en: In order to purchase a mill to meet the needs of his clients, Yawo is asking for his first loan. He is married to a hairstylist, with two children, 12 and 8 years old, both in school, in his care. He hopes to assure the well-being of his family and maintain the sustainability of his business. Yawo is 45 years old.

loans.use: to buy another mill to better serve customers

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.en: Bertrand is a 37-year-old Cameroonian. He is single and has one child who is four years old and attends primary school. He has been in this business for over three years which makes him very experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his profit by 25%, and his standard of living will improve as well.

loans.use: To buy cloth or tissue to sew and sell

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es: Zeneyda tiene 29 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace varios años; anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica. Pero deseaba tener su propio negocio, así que, con el dinero de su liquidación instala su pulpería. Hoy en día cuenta con su propio local prospero. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de su casa. Solicita un crédito para comprar: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, pan, gaseosas, jabones, entre otros, con el fin de aumentar sus productos más solicitado por sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofertar sus productos aumentando sus ventas e incrementando sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y comprando más productos.
texts.en: Zeneyda is 29 years old, married, and has a son.  She is from Esteli, is a merchant, and has a store which she started several years ago.  She used to work at a factory but wanted to have her own business so she opened her store with her severance pay.  Now she has a successful store.  Her next goal is to improve the conditions in her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, bread, soft drinks, soaps, and other things so she can have the things that her customers most request.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help since she will be able to offer her products and increase her sales and income.  Her plans for the future are to grow her business and buy more products.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in Dolores,Clarin,Philippines.

Maribel sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 2,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Dolores,Clarin,Philippines.

Marita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Marita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Marita hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is a 33-year-old married woman with no children. She lives in Pan-ay,Clarin,Philippines.

Arcily sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She requests a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Arcily has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Arcily hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a 42-year- old widow with 6 children.   He lives in Colambutan,Settlement,Tudela. 

To earn a living, Fernando has a business selling native wine or ''tuba'' in the community. He earns about 7,000 PHP each month. Fernando requests a loan to restock his store with native wine or ''tuba''.

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Fernando would like to start other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to restock his store with native wine or ''tuba''.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with 5 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Philippines.

Victoria is a farmer and grows fruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She requests a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Victoria has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Victoria hopes to start other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives in Dilijan city which is in the Tavush region. He is married and he has two beautiful daughters.  Both of them are already students. His elder daughter studies at the paid division of Yerevan State University and the faculty of Philology at the department of Russian Language and Literature. His second daughter studies at the same University and the same faculty but at the department of Romano and Germanic languages, but she also studies at the paid division. Grigor works at the computer office and there he repairs computers and printing machines.  His wife also works there as a manager. Despite that both of them are employed, nevertheless they both do not manage to earn their family living and also to pay for their daughters’ education.
Grigor asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his daughters’ tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his daughters’ tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Gilberth Osvaldo

texts.es: Gilberth de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Él es un joven trabajador quien se gana la vida por medio de la costura artesanal. Junto a su madre han logrado establecer un pequeño taller de costura el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tienen mucho tiempo de haber establecido su pequeño negocio por lo que cuentan con mucha clientela que cada día los prefieren más. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en las materias primas (variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, etc.) para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Gilberth is 21 years old and has lived in a home of his own with his family for some time.  He is a young worker who earns a living by doing artistic sewing.  He and his mother have managed to set up a sewing shop which is their main source of income.  They have had their small business for a long time and have many customers who prefer them.  He is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy supplies (a variety of fabrics, thread, needles, etc.) to make clothing and be able to cover their customer demand and increase their sales and income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Bao Beoneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr ZAKARYA est responsable du groupe BAO BEONEERE. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. Personne ne va  à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est boutiquier  depuis 02ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes .
Il veut s’acheter 15 sacs de riz, 05 bidons d’huile de 20 litres et  10 cartons de spaguetti.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle et mieux s’occuper de sa  famille .
texts.en:
Zakarya is the head of the Bao Beoneere group. He is married and the father of two. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is one. Neither of them is in school. Zakarya has three people in his care.

Zakarya has been running a shop for two years. He buys his supplies at the local market. He has both male and female customers.

He would like to buy 15 sacks of rice, five 20-litre cans of oil and ten boxes of spaghetti.

Zakarya would like to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to buy a plot of land and be able to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice, five 20-litre cans of oil and 10 boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Blema Tesaa 2 Group

texts.en:
This group, "Blema Tesaa 2," comprises ten members, all entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They are into the sales of scarves, sandals, provisions, sugar cane, traditional clothing (kente) and underwear. This is their first loan with Kiva and their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Regina, has been in the group for the past three years. She has established a good friendship with all of her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Josephine is 56 years old and single living with her twenty-two year old daughter. She stays in the family house she lives in, and her child is school-going.

For 20 years, Regina, who is second from the left in the photo, has been selling 'Kente' clothing (traditional clothing) throughout the week at her shop. 

She plans to use the new loan to buy more clothing so that she can sell enough to take care of her child. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her child. 

The total loan amount of 7,200 Ghana cedi (GHS) is to improve businesses.

loans.use: to buy more clothing so that she can sell enough to take care of her child.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs Uranchimeg, 46 years old, lives with her husband and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching children at kindergarten for 11 years. Her husband is currently unemployed. Her sister has the position of distribution manager at a private firm. She is requesting a loan of 4,900,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it emits less harmful pollutants into the air. Uranchimeg's husband will use the car for a taxi service in order to generate income.

loans.use: to buy an electric car so that her husband can use it for taxi service

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is an entrepreneur who is married and has four children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 23 years. Little by little with the passing of the years, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to attract a large number of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are happy with her work. 

Salima is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Dúo Acuarius Group

texts.es: Dúo Acuarius LA SEÑORA Ledy de 45 años de edad,madre de 3 hijos y estan estudiando ella tiene un negocio de estetica de belleza la cual lleva varios años de tenerla y le ha ido muy bien, anterior mente tubo un credito en kiva la cual utilizo en la invercion de su negocio, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de belleza ya que se viene la epoca navideña y es cuando mas demanda tiene de sus clientes esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando.
texts.en: Ledy is 45 years old and the mother of three children who attend school.  She has had a beauty salon business for several years and it has gone well for her.  She has previously had a Kiva loan which she used to invest into her business.  This time she is asking for a loan to buy beauty products because the Christmas season is approaching and this is when her customer demand increases and this loan will be of help to her.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit has become a very expected and responsible client both for Nor Horizon and Kiva. He lives in Ijevan with his wife, two daughters, and his parents. 

Davit has a rich and accurate credit history; in Nor Horizon he already has five loans and this will be his third loan from Kiva. Davit’s first Kiva loan was of great help for him, since at that time he was engaged in bee keeping, and he bought 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers, and frames for his bee families. 

The second Kiva loan he used for his new occupation; he installs and maintains gas cylinders in cars (with the help of the loan he bought several gas cylinders and new equipment to install cylinders in customer cars). He continues with this business.

Now Davit asks his third Kiva loan in an amount of 1,100,000 Armenian drams again to buy several gas cylinders and some needed materials for his work. This will be his third loan from Kiva, and he greatly needs it.

Davit says all the income from his work he spends for the needs of his young family.  He also managed to build a small garage for his car service activities, since he used to work in his yard.

loans.use: to buy several gas cylinders and some needed materials for his work

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 35 years old and he lives in Ijevan city which is in Tavush region. He is married and he has two sons. Sargis runs his own business; he sells fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market of Ijevan. He is sure that in the whole market, his stall is the most rich, colorful and tasty compared to the others. 

His business income has given him an opportunity to build a small shop and some part of the products they sell inside of it. Sargis sells apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens. All the products he buys from villagers, who have become perfect partners for him. 

This will be Sargis’ third loan from Kiva, and as he says, all the successes and income from his business that he has had for several years are thanks to his previous two Kiva loans and its support. 

He asks for a loan 600,000 Armenian drams in order to refresh his stall’s assortment (apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens).

loans.use: to refresh his stall’s assortment (apples, pears, grapes, bananas, kiwi, oranges, pomegranates, lemons, nuts, tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and greens)

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is 37 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and he has two daughters and a new born son. Vahan’s wife works as a nurse. He works at the biggest company in Armenia producing candies and sweets. He distributes these products to nearly 700 shops in his region. As he mentions, the sweets that this company produces are really very popular and children like them very much. Vahan considers this business very profitable and good for his family. 

Now he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some new assortments of candies and cakes since connected with coming Christmas and New Year's holidays he already has a lot of orders from shops.

loans.use: to buy some new assortments of candies and cakes

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Senaki. She has a husband and five-year-old son. Her husband doesn't have a stable job; sometimes during the month, he has a few orders for renovating and constructing houses. The income from this activity isn't enough for the thee-members family to cover food and everyday costs. 

According to this, Bela has decided to start her own business. Bela couldn't receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product between Kiva and Credo. 

She requested a loan of 300 USD to begin trading in clothing and bed-clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices, and then resell among her friends and neighbors. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Because of the Start Up program, Bela will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothing and bed-clothing.

loans.name: Merabi

texts.en: Merabi is a 47-year-old married man, who lives in Senaki. He lives with his wife, two children, and mother. His wife is unemployed and takes care of his children. His mother gets monthly assistance from the local government. Merabi is a taxi driver; he serves the local people and generates 300-350 GEL per month. Despite this compensation, it's hard to support 4 family members with this income. So, he decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Merabi received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Start up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 1,500 USD, he will purchase clothing and other home products at a wholesale price and sell them in Senaki's agricultural market area. He plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. Merabi is a hard-working and motivated person and the Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Jambuli

texts.en: Jambuli is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Kalinino, Gardabani district. His family includes his parents, wife, two daughters and a son. Jambuli's father works at a petrol station and generates 400 GEL monthly. The borrower is also employed. He is an artisan and gets private orders. Jambuli's average income is 200 GEL per month. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Jambuli has a great desire to start a stable business that will take care of his family's everyday needs. He requested 3,000 GEL to open a general store at his house. He has already built the interior of this store and needs money to purchase a wide range of products. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. This money will also be a great help to his hard-working wife, who will be the sales clerk in the store and have her own activity. Jambuli relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To purchase a wide range of products

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Khovle with his father and wife. Zurab works as a watchman at a capital city shopping center and goes from his village to work every day. He gets a small monthly salary. The family nevertheless lives in poverty because the existing income is not enough for their three-member family. 

Zurab has requested a loan to start a dairy farm. His loan request was approved as part of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The loan will be used for purchasing a milk cow. Zurab will place the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income should increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40% to 50% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and Zurab will be able to expand his farm in future.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow in order to start a dairy business.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is a 51-year-old single man, who lives alone in the village of Gomareti. Shalva cultivates his own plot of land and sows potatoes and pumpkins. Seasonally, he sells his harvested potatoes to the vegetable retailers and goes to the capital city open market to sell pumpkin seeds at wholesale.
 
In order to earn a stable monthly income, Shalva is requesting a loan. With the loan amount, he plans to start a fish selling business. Specifically, he will buy fish in Poti (a town on the eastern Black Sea coast) at wholesale prices and will sell them in his district with a price mark-up. Shalva will generate a good income and will be able to cover his daily expenses easily. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start a fish selling business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is single without children. She is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. Analyn  is a farmer and grows fruit crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers. Analyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Analyn hopes to save and start another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en: Marifi is happily married with three children. She lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor. She has a fishing stand in the market and she generates income from it. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for a year. Because she is a member, PMPC extends help to Marifi with the additional capital for her fishing business. With the loan, the fishing stand she has will be productive and can give her additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment such as fish net

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of grocery goods for more than five years. She earns well for the family and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used her previous loan to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to resell. In the future, Angelita wants to build a house and to ensure that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is from Saguing, Maria, Siquijor. She is 38 years old and married. This year, Jessica applied for membership in PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, Jessica asked for financial assistance of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional  curtains, dresses, shoes and sandals. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy additional curtains, dresses, shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Damilde

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a  Danilde;  con su credikiva ella compró ropa y calzado sobre pedidos y así pudo responder pronto a su clientela. Hoy tiene más liquidez, un buen surtido y sus ventas y utilidades han aumentado, sus ingresos han mejorado fortaleciendo su negocio. Ella dice textualmente a sus financiadores: “Muchas agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, estoy aprovechando esta oportunidad al máximo para que sigan apoyándome.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará juguetería, artículos navideños, como ropa, calzado y detalles para el hogar y mercancía escolar. Con ello permanecerá surtida para este fin de año y también impactará a su clientela con artículos de estudios para estudiantes que muy pronto ingresaran a clases, haciendo de su credikiva una óptima inversión. .
texts.en: Thanks for helping Danilde.  She used her Kiva loan to buy clothing and shoes to order and she was able to respond to her customers.  Now she has more liquidity, a good assortment in her sales and her utility has increased.  Her income has increased and her business is stronger.  She says, “Many thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  I am taking advantage of this opportunity to the maximum so that I can continue to get support.”  She is using her new Kiva loan to buy toys, Christmas items such as clothing, shoes, household goods, and school supplies.  With this she will remain stocked for the end of the year and also provide school supplies for her customers who will soon return to classes, making her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is married with four children. She helps her husband to run a fishing business for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets. She wants to improve their business and be able to provide a better living for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Juana, quien con su credikiva logró invertir en pescado, camarones y productos del mar. Su capital de trabajo ha aumentado paulatinamente y con ello tiene una mayor liquidez. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a  sus financiadores: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo de Kiva y de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir contando con su apoyo para continuar progresando. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará pescado, camarones y también mercancías variadas sobre pedidos, como ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos. Su éxito está potencializado porque responderá a sus mejores clientes y con ello garantizará el pronto retorno de su inversión.
texts.en: Thanks you for helping Juana who used her Kiva loan to buy fish, shrimp, and seafood.  Her working capital has increased gradually and she has more liquidity.  She is sending the following message to the lenders, “Thank you very much for the support from Kiva and Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  I hope to continue with your support to continue making progress.”  She is using her Kiva loan to buy fish, shrimp, and merchandise to order such as clothing, shoes, and ladies’ accessories.  Her potential for success is increasing because she will respond to her best customers and quickly regain her investment.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Gemary

texts.en: Gemary is married with only one child. She runs a general store to add to her husband's income from farming. She has been doing this for five years earning more for the basic needs of the family. She borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She is hoping to improve her business and to provide a better life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace helps her husband to earn a living with her general store and she has been doing this for three years. She sells grocery goods in their community and she earns an income for the family's needs. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. 

She always finds ways to improve their lives.  With her determination in doing her business, Grace hopes to gain more profit to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace helps her husband in their fishing business in order to make a living. She has been doing this for five years and earning well for the family. Aside from this, she sells snacks in their community to earn additional income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets to use for fishing. She is hoping for a stable income so her family has a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah helps her husband to make a living. While her husband is a fisherman, Leah sells fruit in town, and also provides manicure and pedicure services, earning well for the family. 

Leah joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services. She hopes to gain more revenue from all of her business activities, and plans to save a portion of her income to repair their own house for a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She also sells fish at the market. For the last five years in their business, Marilyn has been earning well, and has been able to provide for the needs of her three children. 

She has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase new fishing nets to be used in the business. Marilyn plans to improve her business by acquiring a new fishing boat from her profits.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.name: Melencio

texts.en:
Melencio is married with three children. He operates his own farm to make a living, and has been doing this for many years, and is able to provide for his family's needs. 

Melencio wants to improve his farm to have a greener and more abundant harvest. Without hesitation, Melencio borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his farm. He hopes to have a stable income from the farm to provide a better living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en: Aleksan is an experienced farmer from the Shenik village, in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, and two young sons that are 4 and 3 years old. Aleksan works in the private sector and his wife works at the village kindergarten. Both of them work hard to be able to meet the increasing needs of their family. Their salaries alone, however, are not enough to fully meet the family’s needs. Aleksan is also engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of alfalfa. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. Aleksan currently is eager to expand his agribusiness to be able to cover the increasing costs of the family. To reach his goal Aleksan needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase 8 sheep. Aleksan and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie helps her husband in the fishing business for a living. She has sold fish in the market for ten years, and she earns well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy new fishing nets. 

In the near future, Merlie plans to use her profit to repair their house for better, more comfortable living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y colabora con la economía del hogar. María tiene trece años de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, lociones, cremas y antojitos típicos. Una parte de la vena la realiza de manera ambulante y el resto en su hogar de residencia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de  mercadería. Con el Monto solicitado comprará: ropa, lociones, cremas y carnes para la realización de los antojitos típicos que tanto le demandan sus clientes. Espera poder tener este financiamiento y así poder incrementar su inventario con el fin de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan tener mejores condiciones de vida a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: María is 44 and lives in a house of her own with her husband and her son. The latter is already an adult and helps with household expenses. María has been a retailer for 13 years: she sells clothes, creams, lotions, and a local specialty called 'antojitos'. She sells some of her products door-to-door and some at her house. She asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise and ingredients for her shop. She will buy clothes, creams, and lotions, as well as meat, chicken, sweetcorn, and vegetables to make 'antojitos', which are very sought after by her customers. She hopes to get this loan, which would enable her to have more products in stock, which, in turn, would help her increase her sales and her income, so as to improver her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and ingredients.

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es: Dúo El Carmen, la señora Maria Josefa de 31 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace 13 años, ella empeso a vender unos productos pero dia con dia ha luchado para salir adelante, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles, ya que en esta epoca aumenta la venta y entonces quiere aprovechar para invertir y crecer un poco mas en su negocio, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito.
texts.en: María Josefa, 31 years old, is one of the two integrants of the group 'Dúo El Carmen'. She has been selling groceries for the last 13 years, a business which has proved challenging from the start. She asks for a loan in order to buy more items to sell, since this is a very good season for business, a fact of which she wants to take advantage in order to make her business grow. She hopes for Kiva lenders' help with this loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Alexander

texts.es: Daniel de 20 años de edad habita en casa de su abuela junto a su grupo familiar. Daniel es un joven muy comprometido, trabajador y responsable. Él se dedica  a la venda de ropa para dama, caballero y niño desde hace tres años. Gracias a su carisma y variedad de productos que ofrece tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir para dama, caballeros y niños. Espera poder lograr su objetivo y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Daniel is 20 years old and lives at his grandmother's, together with the rest of the family. He is a very committed, hard-working and responsible youth. He has been selling clothes for women, men, and children for three years. Thanks to his charisma and the variety of products he has on offer, he has many loyal customers. He decided to ask for this loan in order to buy more clothes to sell. He hopes to reach his goal and improve his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Shalom Group

texts.es:
DUO SHALOM
La señora iris quien es integrante del dúo Shalom ha trabajado durante  varios años es madre de 4 hijos y tiene una venta de zapatos y sandalias la cual pudo aperturar con los créditos que la fundación le ha otorgado actualmente se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio ya que tiene muchos sueños y metas no solo para ella si no que también para su familia ya que desea poder aperturar  otro local y tener una venta solo de Zapatos y una venta solo de sandalias, aunque ella bien sabe que se requiere de mucho esfuerzo pero espera en Dios poder lograrlo y ella nuevamente toca las puertas de fape para que se le otorgue un nuevo crédito para la inversión de zapato debido a la temporada que se acerca  esperando en DIOS que ustedes nuevamente le puedan ayudar.
texts.en:
Iris is one of the members of the "Dúo Shalom" group and she has worked for a number of years. She is the mother of four children. She sells shoes and sandals which she was able to start with loans from this foundation. She is working full-time now with her business as she has many goals and dreams. Not only for herself but also for her family. She wants to open another sales location and in one sell only shoes, in the other only sandals. She knows this would require a lot of effort but she trusts that God will help her achieve this.

She is once again knocking at Fape's door to request a new loan to invest in shoes for the coming season. She trusts in God that you will once again help her.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana, who is married and has two children, manages her own store selling grocery items for a living. She has been doing this for three years, and she earns an income that supports her husband's income. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell to boost her store's business. She wants to improve her business to further stabilize the family income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Jesson

texts.en: Jesson is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. He used his previous loan from GDMPC to pay his tuition fees for the first semester. He never allows any hindrances or difficulties to interrupt his ambition to get closer to his dream. Recently, Jesson borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of his school allowances for the current semester.  He wants to got a job related to his degree someday to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his school allowances for the current semester.

loans.name: Evan Nicolas

texts.en: Evan Nicolas is married with an only child. He manages his own rice farm to make a living. In his two years of farming, he has earned well enough to provide for his family. Recently, Evan Nicolas borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer in order to improve the farm. He hopes to be able to buy another farm to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella sells cosmetic products in her community to make a living. She collects her sales in cash or on an amortization basis where she can cater to her costumers. She has been doing this for more than two years and she earns well and she supports her husband's income from employment.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional cosmetic products to resell for she had more orders from her costumers. Ella wants to have a better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is running a little retail store in their community selling selected grocery items to make a living. She just started her business six months ago and she plans to expand her offerings.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to pay for a coffee vending machine where she could sell coffee anytime. She wants to use her profit to improve her house and her business as well.

loans.use: to pay for coffee vending machine

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Maravillas” está conformada por 08 socios dispuestos a seguir trabajando bien. Gregoria es viuda y tiene 05 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. A sus 49 años Gregoria ha logrado mejorar su situación económica. Su último crédito lo destinó para la compra de verduras y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de tener su propio local donde pueda ofrecer sus verduras. El grupo “Las Maravillas” agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito ya que hace posible su progreso. Gregoria se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
The “Las Maravillas” communal bank is made up of eight members who are ready to continue working well. Gregoria is a widow, with five children, two of whom are still dependent on her. She sells vegetables door to door. At 49 years old she has been able to improve her economic situation. Her last loan was used to buy vegetables to offer to her customers. Her main desire is to have her own sales location to sell her vegetables.

The “Las Maravillas” communal bank members are grateful to the people who make this loan possible and allow them to progress. Gregoria is sitting in the photo, the first person on the left side, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nelie Fe

texts.en: Nelie Fe is married with four children, and she sells snacks in her community to aid her husband's income from farming. She has been selling rice cakes for twenty years. In this season, she got more orders, so she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional ingredients to cook. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Mary- Ann

texts.en:
Mary- Ann is studying for a BS in Information Technology at MU Oroqueita City. Mary- Ann joined Gata Daku MPC and she used her previous loan in paying her first semester tuition fees.

Recently she took another loan to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. She is hopeful of finding a job after finishing her studies to be able to support the needs of her parents and to have a better future of her own.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Genny Mae

texts.en:
Genny Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her parents are both private employees but,  having six siblings, their income is not good enough to support all their family's needs.

She used her previous loan from GDMPC in paying her school tuition fees for the first semester.  To continue her studies, she now took another loan to pay her uniforms used for her on-the-job training activities. Her ambition is to finish her studies.  She wants to help her parents and the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Allan Jr.

texts.en:
Allan Jr. is studying for a BS in Criminology at Misamis University in Oroquieta City. He has a dream of having a job to earn money for his better future.

He is about to finish his course and now needs an intern uniform as their school requires . Without hesitation, Allan Jr. borrowed a new loan to pay for his uniform. He is hopeful to become successful in his future.

loans.use: to pay for intern uniform costs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with two children and she helps her husband operating their little farm to make a living. With three years of harvesting bananas, she was able to provide the needs of the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve her banana farm. She hopes to have a better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina is married with three children.  She manages a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for ten years and she earns well for the family.

She joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business in order to improve her income and plans to save a portion of her profit to use it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Herber Ulises

texts.es:
Herber de 49 años de edad, es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado y es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que van a la escuela,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

Herber  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar al terreno camina 3 Km.  y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras  su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde, eé cuida los animales  en los potreros que alquila.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vaca lecheras y producir mas leche para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Él desea, comprar un terreno para construir su casa, ya que actualmente están alquilando lo que le genera mas costos.
texts.en:
Herber is 49 years old. He only studied until Grade 9. He is married, his wife takes care of the house. His wife and his children, who attend school, are dependent on him.

Herber works in agriculture an activity that his parents taught him. He gets up at 4 am and walks 3 kilometers to get to his fields. He works through the morning, while his wife milks the cows and sells the milk. In the afternoons he takes care of the animals in the fields they rent.

The loan Herber is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two milk cows to produce more milk for sale and obtain more revenue to support his family. He wants to buy a plot of land to build a house as they presently rent and this generates more expenses.

loans.use: to buy two more milk cows to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino de 53 años de edad, se ha dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa para Dama Caballero y niños, y gracias a Dios su negocio ha prosperado, el ya ha trabajado otros creditos en kiva y no cayo en mora, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta y asi seguir creciendo en su negocio, desde ya les desea una Feliz navidad y prospero año nuevo lleno de bendicion y gracias por ayudarlo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rufino is 53 years old. For the past several years he has been selling clothing for men, woman and children. Thanks to God his business has prospered. He has taken out other loans with Kiva and has never fallen behind on his payments.

At this time Rufino is requesting a loan to buy new clothes to sell and continue to expand his business. He wishes everyone a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year, full of grace. He is grateful for the support to help him get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is married with four children, and she runs a general store for a living. She has been selling grocery goods for six years and she earns well for the family. Her husband also earns money from their farm, their main source of income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery goods to resell. In the future, Milagros wants to improve her business and hopes to create a better living situation for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a single mom of two children and runs a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for three years and she earns well so that she was able to provide the needs of her children.

Recently she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. Joan want to have a better living situation with her own family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and manages her own retail store to make a living. Her husband is also earning from working as a driver. She has been selling grocery goods in their community for three years and she earns well for the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan to purchase grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business and plans to use her profit as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson owns and operates a business venture selling fresh eggs in the local community to earn a living. Aside from this, he also operates his own farm of rice as their main source of income. He has been working on his farm for ten years, earning well for the family.

He used his previous loan from GDMPC in purchasing a vehicle to be used in the business and with his better income, Nelson had successfully repaid it. Recently he borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and for weeding maintenance costs in order to improve his farm. In the future, Nelson hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is married with two children, and he helps his wife run a retail store to make a living. He has been in this business for six years, and it helps the family's finances. He also works part-time as a driver. Recently, Rey joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell and capital for a business buying and selling pigs. Rey wants to improve his investment and thereby improve his family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell and capital for a business buying and selling pigs.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie is married with three children, and he runs a general store selling goods in the market to make a living. He has been doing this for five years and earns well for the family. Recently, Rubie borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to resell. He is hopeful to gain more returns from the business. He wants to have a better living for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married and had three children. She runs a retail store to make a living. For being two years in the business, Vergie earns so well that she was able to provide the needs of her children. She always find ways in order to improve her business.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. In the future, Vergie wants to have a better living situation with the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with two children and helps her husband operating their own farm for a living. She has been helping him for more than ten years and she earns well for the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to replant bananas and for fertilization costs in order to improve the farm. With their farm, Wilma was able to earn money and support her children's education. In the future, Wilma wants to have a better life for the entire family.

loans.use: to replant bananas and for fertilization costs

loans.name: Mihran

texts.en:
Mihran lives together with his mother, who doesn't work and takes care of the household. Mihran is the only breadwinner in the family and feels very responsible for being able to provide appropriate living conditions for his mother.

Mihran provides service from a small rented garage in the center of Kapan town. He is already well known among locals as a good quality service provider. The tools that Mihran uses in his work are too old. Because of daily costs, Mihran isn't able to purchase new tools with his own financial means, so he has applied to SEF for help. The loan of 600,000 AMD will greatly assist Mihran to purchase tools and materials for providing his vehicle repair service.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Mihran and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing vehicle repair service

loans.name: Mihran

texts.en:
Mihran lives in Kapan town with his wife and son. He has been involved in the renovation business for four years already. He is a well-known specialist in the region and his services are very in demand by locals. As the only breadwinner of the family, it is very difficult for Mihran to pay the family's daily costs and at the same time save money for investing in equipment and tools necessary for its services.

Mihran isn't able to purchase new equipment (a perforator). Mihran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Mihran, as by purchasing the necessary equipment it will be easier for him to continue providing renovation services.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 33 years old and he lives in Berkaber village in the Tavush region. After coming back from the army, he got married and, together with his parents, became engaged in farming and agriculture in order to provide his family with good living conditions. Sometimes he also does some construction work and tries somehow to enlarge their family income.

On their farm he has 4 cows, 4 piglets and 20 chickens. Thanks to their agricultural activities, they manage to sell wheat, corn, figs and persimmons. They also sell milk and eggs. All the resellers buy right from their farm. Davit’s wife does not work and she takes care of their two children.

Davit asks for a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder (feed) that will be enough during winter months.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Bethel Shg Group

texts.en:
These hard-working women have called themselves by the group name “Bethel”. They all live in Bishnupur which is in the state of Manipur, Northeastern region of India. They formed a group with an aim to generate income for themselves by accessing a loan. 

Rumunhoi is one of the six members of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and has one daughter. Her husband is in the army. Rumunhoi opened a 'pan' shop near the market area. With the loan amount she wishes to expand and refill the shop by buying varieties of chips in packets, cigarettes, and betel leaf/nut which are in demand. She believes that her shop will be a source of generating income for the family instead of her being fully dependent on her husband’s salary. Her daughter is studying in grade one, and she wishes to send her daughter to good schools in the future to receive quality education. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members also aspire to raise their economic, financial and living standards by generating more income. Some of the group members do chives cultivation, weaving or have 'pan' shops.

loans.use: To purchase more items like betel nut/leaf, cigarettes, bar soap, candies and many kinds of chips to sell.

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ivania es muy trabajadora, lucha a diario por salir adelante junto a su familia, es  madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a vender bisuterías en su casa de habitación  así  como también  hace entrega a domicilio por encargos, su esposo trabaja  como albañil, de esta manera ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. Ivania solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción con lo que instalara servicio higiénico y continuara parte del muro perimetral  de la parte posterior de su vivienda, lo cual es muy necesario por la delincuencia andando en su barrio, así le brindara a sus hijos seguridad y prosperidad en cuanto a las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ivania is very hardworking. She fights every day to get ahead with her family. She is the mother of three school aged children. She works selling jewelry in her house and she also delivers orders to people's home. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Both of them share the household expenses. Ivania is asking for this loan with the purpose of buying construction materials to install a bathroom and continue building a part of the wall around the back part of the house. This is very necessary because of the crime in her neighborhood. This will give her children more security and prosperity for their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, a toilet, PVC tubes and more.

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
Irma se decidió por otro crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para preparar el terreno y cultivar sin ningún inconveniente. Así su cosecha de maíz será abundante y de calidad.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, incrementar sus ganancias, cancelar puntual las cuotas y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en: Irma decided to take out another loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor costs to prepare the soil and plant without any problems. This way, her corn crop will be abundant and of good quality. The previous investment helped her to fortify her business, increase her earnings, make her payments on time and give her family better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Xiomara Ines

texts.es: Xiomara es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 29 años de edad. Casada y madre de un hijo. Se dedica al negocio de panadería. Inicio este negocio hace tres años, vendiendo poco pan en su barrio. Tiempo después su negocio iba creciendo. Hoy en día cuenta con una panadería estable y con una gran cantidad de clientela. Su meta próxima es asegurarle un futuro a su hija. Solicita un crédito para comprar: harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, polvo para hornear entre otros, con el fin de realizar más pan y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será beneficioso ya que podrá aumentar su producción de pan y generarle mejores ingresos con la venta. Su plan futuro es apoyar a su hija en sus estudios.
texts.en: Xiomara is from the city of Boaco. She is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. She works in the bread baking business. She started this business three years ago, selling a little bit of bread in her neighborhood. some time later, her business grew. Now she has a stable bread bakery and a lot of customers. Her next goal is to ensure her daughter's future.  She is asking for a loan to buy: flour, eggs, sugar, lard, baking powder and more, in order to make more bread and fill her customer's orders. She thinks the loan will be very beneficial for her since she can increase bread production and generate better income with the sales. Her plan for the future is to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, lard, baking powder and more.

loans.name: Na Mungu Tutaweza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Francine est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Na Mungu tutaweza », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 25 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari de l’argent reçu de la tontine. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The client, Francine, is a fearless businesswoman, the president and member of the "Na Mungu Tutaweza" business collective and a dynamic entrepreneur. She is a 25-year-old mother of four children, who are all currently receiving an education. This client sells clothing made from pagne. She shows off her wares at the busy town market. She started her business with her husband's assistance, using the money received from a savings group. Her spouse is also a retail trader. Later, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running this business for four years. This new loan will allow her to buy 50 pieces of pagne cloth. With this loan, she wishes to increase her profits, to pay for her children's school fees and to feed them. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the work they do to liberate women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system, especially during this critical moment of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of pagne cloth

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is 30 years old and he lives in the village of Dashtashem in Lori region. He is married and he has a 5-year-old daughter. He lives in a rented house with his wife and child. 

Sergey graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with a degree in geography and economics. Now he is a director of the village school and at the same time he is a teacher of geography there. As he says the mission of being a teacher means to be responsible and careful, with rich knowledge to be able to educate younger generations. In the school he tries to organize interesting and informative competitions and games.

He is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some professional literature to be more informed and aware of new methods and programs of teaching techniques.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature to be more informed and aware of new methods and programs of teaching techniques

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 50 years old and he lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. He is married and he has a son, who now is completing his military service in the army, and a daughter, who is school-aged. Samvel’s wife works as a deputy of the school director. 

Samvel is a skilled driver and for many years he has operated a private company, providing transportation in his own car. Samvel has one more car, which his friend drives as a taxi, and they divide the income from it.

Samvel is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to repair and buy winter car tires for his two cars.

loans.use: to repair and buy winter car tires for his two cars

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 51 years old and she lives in the city of Spitak in Lori region. She has two daughters: the elder is married and living with her family, and her younger daughter is a student at the Yerevan State Conservatory Musical Institute. Marine’s husband died several years ago, and since their children were small Marine had to endure many difficulties alone in order to provide her daughters with good living conditions. As a result of her great efforts, both of her daughters have received higher education. 

Marine works at the bank as a senior specialist. She lives alone, because her younger daughter who is a student lives in Yerevan in a rented flat. She is a very talented and clever girl. She simultaneously works at the choir.

Marine is asking for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her daughter’s postgraduate course and to buy some furniture for the rented flat where her daughter now lives.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s postgraduate course and to buy some furniture for the rented flat where her daughter lives

loans.name: Tatay-Yirra Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tatay-Yirra” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) per member in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Fatmata, 35 years old, is the featured leader of this group. She is married and has five children; three of them are attending primary school, one is in secondary school and one is not yet school-aged. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for ten years, selling baby clothes, bed sheets, etc. She will use her share of this loan to buy a large quantity of baby clothes, bed sheets, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of baby clothes, bed sheets, etc. to add to her current stock

loans.name: Never Lose Hope Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Never Lose Hope” group. They are small scale business-people based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to enable them to further expand their respective businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.
 
The featured leader of this group is Mabinty. Mabinty is age thirty and was born in Kambia town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Mabinty has sold cooked rice with a delicious sauce. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to stop buying these items at retail. In this way, she will be able to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, palm-oil, maggi, salt, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to stop buying this items at retail.

loans.name: Believe God Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Believe God” group from Waterloo, a rapidly growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mary is the featured leader of this group. The thirty-nine-year-old is married to a teacher and they have six children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mary has been a businesswoman for twelve years now. She sells cooked rice and delicious sauce. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to stop buying these items at retail. In this way, she will be able to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in large quantity in order to cook a larger quantity of rice/sauce for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 59 years old and she lives in the city of Vanadzor in Lori region. She has four children: three of them are married and live separately with their families. Susan’s husband died many years ago. Now she lives with her youngest school-aged daughter and her retired mother, who is 93 years old and was a participant in the Great Patriotic War. 

Susan graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with a degree in aesthetics, and she is currently a deputy director at the school. She is a very clever and wise woman, and she does her work with great care and responsibility. 

Susan is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some literature about teaching methodology and techniques.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature about teaching methodology and techniques

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
Artsrun, 21 years old, lives in Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He is not married and lives with his parents and his sister. After coming back from the army, Artsrun established his own rather profitable business, selling a great range of stationery in a rented shop. The assortment of goods in his shop is great and perfect; he sells  notebooks, folders, pens, pencils, felt-tip pens, rulers, calculators, children’s fairy tale books, watercolors, special glues for papers and more, all sorted so neatly, so one can find and buy anything. Artsrun is a very cute and polite young man who never has a lack of customers, thanks to his pleasant attitude toward visitors to his shop. Artsrun's strong business skills bring about good sales, thus providing his family with high living conditions.

Artsrun is asking for a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy a new scanner and a new document copying machine since the last one is out of order.

loans.use: to buy a new document copying machine and a new scanner

loans.name: Go Try I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Go Try I” group from Waterloo, a fast growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 7,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. The fifty-two-year-old is married to a trader and they have four children. Elizabeth has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy the a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en:
Mustapha is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mustapha was born in Masima, in northern Sierra Leone, fifty-two years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple have three children who are attending secondary and tertiary academic institutions. Mustapha sells sticks (used primarily for fencing) and has been doing this type of business for four years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mustapha and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mustapha will use his share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy sticks at wholesale which he will then sell at retail.

loans.use: to buy sticks at wholesale which he will then sell at retail.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, tiene una familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos, es el pilar principal de su familia, genera sus ingresos realizando el cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y lo realiza desde muy joven.
Comprará abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara y tendrá una mejor cosecha. Espera tener una cosecha abundante, mejorar las ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con darle a su familia mejores condiciones alimenticias y de vestuario.
texts.en:
